member.name: T:GodotEngine.AStar
member.summary: A* (A star) is a computer algorithm that is widely used in pathfinding and graph traversal, the process of plotting an efficiently directed path between multiple points. It enjoys widespread use due to its performance and accuracy. Godot's A* implementation make use of vectors as points. You must add points manually with [method AStar.add_point] and create segments manually with [method AStar.connect_points]. So you can test if there is a path between two points with the [method AStar.are_points_connected] function, get the list of existing ids in the found path with [method AStar.get_id_path], or the points list with [method AStar.get_point_path].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.add_point(System.Int32,GodotEngine.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Add a new point at the given position [code]pos[/code] with the given identifier [code]id[/code]. The [code]weight_scale[/code] has to be 1 or larger.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.get_point_pos(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of point with given id.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.get_point_weight_scale(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the weight scale of point with given id.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.remove_point(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the point with given id.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.has_point(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the point with given id exists on AStar;

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.connect_points(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a segment between points [code]id[/code] and [code]to_id[/code].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.disconnect_points(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a segment between points [code]id[/code] and [code]to_id[/code].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.are_points_connected(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if there is a connection/segment between points [code]id[/code] and [code]from_id[/code]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.clear
member.summary: Clear all the points and segments from AStar instance.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.get_closest_point(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the id of closest point of given point. -1 is returned if there are no points on AStar.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.get_closest_pos_in_segment(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the position of closest point that has segments.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.get_point_path(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array with the points of path found by AStar between two given points.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.AStar.get_id_path(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array with the point ids of path found by AStar between two given points.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Animation
member.summary: An Animation resource contains data used to animate everything in the engine. Animations are divided into tracks, and each track must be linked to a node. The state of that node can be changed through time, by adding timed keys (events) to the track. Animations are just data containers, and must be added to odes such as an [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimationTreePlayer] to be played back.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Animation.TYPE_VALUE
member.summary: Value tracks set values in node properties, but only those which can be Interpolated.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Animation.TYPE_TRANSFORM
member.summary: Transform tracks are used to change node local transforms or skeleton pose bones. Transitions are Interpolated.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Animation.TYPE_METHOD
member.summary: Method tracks call functions with given arguments per key.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Animation.INTERPOLATION_NEAREST
member.summary: No interpolation (nearest value).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Animation.INTERPOLATION_LINEAR
member.summary: Linear interpolation.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Animation.INTERPOLATION_CUBIC
member.summary: Cubic interpolation.

member.summary: Remove a track by specifying the track index.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Area
member.summary: General purpose area detection for 3D physics. Areas can be used for detection of objects that enter/exit them, as well as overriding space parameters (changing gravity, damping, etc). For this, use any space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLE and point gravity at the center of mass.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_space_override_mode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the space override mode. This mode controls how an area affects gravity and damp. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_space_override_mode
member.summary: Return the space override mode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_gravity_is_point(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When overriding space parameters, this method sets whether this area has a center of gravity. To set/get the location of the center of gravity, use [method set_gravity_vector]/[method get_gravity_vector].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.is_gravity_a_point
member.summary: Return whether gravity is a point. A point gravity will attract objects towards it, as opposed to a gravity vector, which moves them in a given direction.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_gravity_distance_scale(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the falloff factor for point gravity. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_gravity_distance_scale
member.summary: Return the falloff factor for point gravity.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_gravity_vector(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Set the gravity vector. This vector does not have to be normalized. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_gravity_vector
member.summary: Return the gravity vector. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_gravity(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the gravity intensity. This is useful to alter the force of gravity without altering its direction. This value multiplies the gravity vector, whether it is the given vector ([method set_gravity_vector]), or a calculated one (when using a center of gravity).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_gravity
member.summary: Return the gravity intensity.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_angular_damp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the rate at which objects stop spinning in this area, if there are not any other forces making it spin. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops. In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_angular_damp
member.summary: Return the angular damp rate.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_linear_damp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the rate at which objects stop moving in this area, if there are not any other forces moving it. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops. In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_linear_damp
member.summary: Return the linear damp rate.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_priority(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the order in which the area is processed. Greater values mean the area gets processed first. This is useful for areas which have an space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED or AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE, as they replace values, and are thus order-dependent. Areas with the same priority value get evaluated in an unpredictable order, and should be differentiated if evaluation order is to be important.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_priority
member.summary: Return the processing order of this area.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_collision_mask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_collision_mask
member.summary: Return the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_collision_layer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers are not visual, but more of a tagging system instead. A collidable can use these layers/tags to select with which objects it can collide, using [method set_collision_mask]. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_collision_layer
member.summary: Return the physics layer this area is in.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_collision_mask_bit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_collision_mask_bit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.set_collision_layer_bit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This makes getting an area in/out of only one layer easier.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area.get_collision_layer_bit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return an individual bit on the layer mask.

member.summary: Return whether this area can be detected by other, monitoring, areas.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Area2D
member.summary: General purpose area detection for 2D physics. Areas can be used for detection of objects that enter/exit them, as well as overriding space parameters (changing gravity, damping, etc). For this, use any space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLE and point gravity at the center of mass.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.set_space_override_mode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the space override mode. This mode controls how an area affects gravity and damp. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.get_space_override_mode
member.summary: Return the space override mode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.set_gravity_is_point(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When overriding space parameters, this method sets whether this area has a center of gravity. To set/get the location of the center of gravity, use [method set_gravity_vector]/[method get_gravity_vector].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.is_gravity_a_point
member.summary: Return whether gravity is a point. A point gravity will attract objects towards it, as opposed to a gravity vector, which moves them in a given direction.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.set_gravity_distance_scale(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the falloff factor for point gravity. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.get_gravity_distance_scale
member.summary: Return the falloff factor for point gravity.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.set_gravity_vector(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the gravity vector. This vector does not have to be normalized. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.get_gravity_vector
member.summary: Return the gravity vector. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.set_gravity(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the gravity intensity. This is useful to alter the force of gravity without altering its direction. This value multiplies the gravity vector, whether it is the given vector ([method set_gravity_vector]), or a calculated one (when using a center of gravity).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.get_gravity
member.summary: Return the gravity intensity.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.set_linear_damp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the rate at which objects stop moving in this area, if there are not any other forces moving it. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops. In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.get_linear_damp
member.summary: Return the linear damp rate.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.set_angular_damp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the rate at which objects stop spinning in this area, if there are not any other forces making it spin. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops. In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.get_angular_damp
member.summary: Return the angular damp rate.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.set_priority(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the order in which the area is processed. Greater values mean the area gets processed first. This is useful for areas which have an space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED or AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE, as they replace values, and are thus order-dependent. Areas with the same priority value get evaluated in an unpredictable order, and should be differentiated if evaluation order is to be important.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Area2D.get_priority
member.summary: Return the processing order of this area.

member.summary: Sets the copy mode to the entire screen.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.BackBufferCopy.get_copy_mode
member.summary: Return the copy mode currently applied to the BackBufferCopy (refer to constants section).

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Camera
member.summary: Camera is a special node that displays what is visible from its current location. Cameras register themselves in the nearest [Viewport] node (when ascending the tree). Only one camera can be active per viewport. If no viewport is available ascending the tree, the Camera will register in the global viewport. In other words, a Camera just provides [i]3D[/i] display capabilities to a [Viewport], and, without one, a scene registered in that [Viewport] (or higher viewports) can't be displayed.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Camera.PROJECTION_PERSPECTIVE
member.summary: Perspective Projection (object's size on the screen becomes smaller when far away).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Camera.PROJECTION_ORTHOGONAL
member.summary: Orthogonal Projection (objects remain the same size on the screen no matter how far away they are).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera.project_ray_normal(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Return a normal vector in worldspace, that is the result of projecting a point on the [Viewport] rectangle by the camera projection. This is useful for casting rays in the form of (origin,normal) for object intersection or picking.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera.project_ray_origin(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Return a 3D position in worldspace, that is the result of projecting a point on the [Viewport] rectangle by the camera projection. This is useful for casting rays in the form of (origin,normal) for object intersection or picking.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera.unproject_position(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Return how a 3D point in worldspace maps to a 2D coordinate in the [Viewport] rectangle.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera.set_perspective(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the camera projection to perspective mode, by specifying a [i]FOV[/i] Y angle in degrees (FOV means Field of View), and the [i]near[/i] and [i]far[/i] clip planes in worldspace units.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera.set_orthogonal(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the camera projection to orthogonal mode, by specifying a width and the [i]near[/i] and [i]far[/i] clip planes in worldspace units. (As a hint, 2D games often use this projection, with values specified in pixels)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera.make_current
member.summary: Make this camera the current Camera for the [Viewport] (see class description). If the Camera Node is outside the scene tree, it will attempt to become current once it's added.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera.is_current
member.summary: Return whether the Camera is the current one in the [Viewport], or plans to become current (if outside the scene tree).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera.get_camera_transform
member.summary: Get the camera transform. Subclassed cameras (such as CharacterCamera) may provide different transforms than the [Node] transform.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Camera2D
member.summary: Camera node for 2D scenes. It forces the screen (current layer) to scroll following this node. This makes it easier (and faster) to program scrollable scenes than manually changing the position of [CanvasItem] based nodes. This node is intended to be a simple helper get get things going quickly and it may happen often that more functionality is desired to change how the camera works. To make your own custom camera node, simply inherit from [Node2D] and change the transform of the canvas by calling get_viewport().set_canvas_transform(m) in [Viewport].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera2D.set_offset(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the scroll offset. Useful for looking around or camera shake animations.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera2D.get_offset
member.summary: Return the scroll offset.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera2D.make_current
member.summary: Make this the current 2D camera for the scene (viewport and layer), in case there's many cameras in the scene.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera2D.is_current
member.summary: Return true of this is the current camera (see [method make_current]).

member.summary: Set the scrolling limit in pixels.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera2D.get_limit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the scrolling limit in pixels.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera2D.set_limit_smoothing_enabled(System.Boolean)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Camera2D.set_drag_margin(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the margins needed to drag the camera (relative to the screen size). Margin uses the MARGIN_* enum. Drag margins of 0,0,0,0 will keep the camera at the center of the screen, while drag margins of 1,1,1,1 will only move when the camera is at the edges.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.CanvasItem
member.summary: Base class of anything 2D. Canvas items are laid out in a tree and children inherit and extend the transform of their parent. CanvasItem is extended by [Control], for anything GUI related, and by [Node2D] for anything 2D engine related. Any CanvasItem can draw. For this, the "update" function must be called, then NOTIFICATION_DRAW will be received on idle time to request redraw. Because of this, canvas items don't need to be redraw on every frame, improving the performance significantly. Several functions for drawing on the CanvasItem are provided (see draw_* functions). They can only be used inside the notification, signal or _draw() overrides function, though. Canvas items are draw in tree order. By default, children are on top of their parents so a root CanvasItem will be drawn behind everything (this can be changed per item though). Canvas items can also be hidden (hiding also their subtree). They provide many means for changing standard parameters such as opacity (for it and the subtree) and self opacity, blend mode. Ultimately, a transform notification can be requested, which will notify the node that its global position changed in case the parent tree changed.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_MIX
member.summary: Mix blending mode. Colors are assumed to be independent of the alpha (opacity) value.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_ADD
member.summary: Additive blending mode.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_SUB
member.summary: Subtractive blending mode.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_MUL
member.summary: Multiplicative blending mode.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_PREMULT_ALPHA
member.summary: Mix blending mode. Colors are assumed to be premultiplied by the alpha (opacity) value.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.CanvasLayer
member.summary: Canvas Item layer. [CanvasItem] nodes that are direct or indirect children of a [CanvasLayer] will be drawn in that layer. The layer is a numeric index that defines the draw order. The default 2D scene renders with index 0, so a [CanvasLayer] with index -1 will be drawn below, and one with index 1 will be drawn above. This is very useful for HUDs (in layer 1+ or above), or backgrounds (in layer -1 or below).

member.summary: Set the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.CollisionPolygon2D
member.summary: Editor-only class. This is not present when running the game. It's used in the editor to properly edit and position collision shapes in [CollisionObject2D]. This is not accessible from regular code. This class is for editing custom shape polygons.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.CollisionPolygon2D.set_polygon(GodotEngine.Vector2[])
member.summary: Set the array of points forming the polygon. When editing the point list via the editor, depending on [method get_build_mode], it has to be a list of points (for [code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a list of lines (for [code]build_mode==1[/code]). In the second case, the even elements of the array define the start point of the line, and the odd elements the end point.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.CollisionPolygon2D.get_polygon
member.summary: Return the list of points that define the polygon.

member.summary: Set whether the polygon is to be a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==1[/code]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.CollisionPolygon2D.get_build_mode
member.summary: Return whether the polygon is a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==1[/code]).

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ConcavePolygonShape
member.summary: Concave polygon shape resource, which can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or area. This shape is created by feeding a list of triangles.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConcavePolygonShape.set_faces(GodotEngine.Vector3[])
member.summary: Set the faces (an array of triangles).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConcavePolygonShape.get_faces
member.summary: Return the faces (an array of triangles).

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ConcavePolygonShape2D
member.summary: Concave polygon 2D shape resource for physics. It is made out of segments and is very optimal for complex polygonal concave collisions. It is really not advised to use for [RigidBody2D] nodes. A CollisionPolygon2D in convex decomposition mode (solids) or several convex objects are advised for that instead. Otherwise, a concave polygon 2D shape is better for static collisions. The main difference between a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] and a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] is that a concave polygon assumes it is concave and uses a more complex method of collision detection, and a convex one forces itself to be convex in order to speed up collision detection.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConcavePolygonShape2D.set_segments(GodotEngine.Vector2[])

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ConfigFile
member.summary: This helper class can be used to store [Variant] values on the filesystem using an INI-style formatting. The stored values as referenced by a section and a key. The stored data can be saved to or parsed from a file, though ConfigFile objects can also be used directly with accessing the filesystem. The following example shows how to parse a INI-style file from the system, read its contents and store new values in it: [codeblock] var config = ConfigFile.new() var err = config.load("user://settings.cfg") if err == OK: # if not, something went wrong with the file loading # Look for the display/width pair, and default to 1024 if missing var screen_width = get_value("display", "width", 1024) # Store a variable if and only it hasn't been defined yet if not config.has_section_key("audio", "mute"): config.set_value("audio", "mute", false) # Save the changes by overwriting the previous file config.save("user://settings.cfg") [/codeblock]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConfigFile.set_value(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Assign a value to the specified key of the the specified section. If the section and/or the key do not exist, they are created. Passing a [code]NULL[/code] value deletes the specified key if it exists (and deletes the section if it ends up empty once the key has been removed).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConfigFile.get_value(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Return the current value for the specified section and key. If the section and/or the key do not exist, the method returns the value of the optional [i]default[/i] argument (and thus [code]NULL[/code] if not specified).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConfigFile.has_section(System.String)
member.summary: Check if the specified section exists.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConfigFile.has_section_key(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check if the specified section-key pair exists.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConfigFile.get_sections
member.summary: Return an array of all defined section identifiers.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConfigFile.get_section_keys(System.String)
member.summary: Return an array of all defined key identifiers in the specified section.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConfigFile.load(System.String)
member.summary: Load the config file specified as a parameter. The file's contents are parsed and loaded in the ConfigFile object from which the method was called. The return value is one of the OK, FAILED or ERR_* constants listed in [@Global Scope] (if the load was successful, it returns OK).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConfigFile.save(System.String)
member.summary: Save the contents of the ConfigFile object to the file specified as a parameter. The output file uses an INI-style structure. The return value is one of the OK, FAILED or ERR_* constants listed in [@Global Scope] (if the save was successful, it returns OK).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Container.NOTIFICATION_SORT_CHILDREN

member.summary: Fit a child control in a given rect. This is mainly a helper for creating custom container classes.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Control
member.summary: Control is the base class Node for all the GUI components. Every GUI component inherits from it, directly or indirectly. In this way, sections of the scene tree made of contiguous control nodes, become user interfaces. Controls are relative to the parent position and size by using anchors and margins. This ensures that they can adapt easily in most situation to changing dialog and screen sizes. When more flexibility is desired, [Container] derived nodes can be used. Anchors work by defining which margin do they follow, and a value relative to it. Allowed anchoring modes are ANCHOR_BEGIN, where the margin is relative to the top or left margins of the parent (in pixels), ANCHOR_END for the right and bottom margins of the parent and ANCHOR_RATIO, which is a ratio from 0 to 1 in the parent range. Input device events are first sent to the root controls via the [method Node._input], which distribute it through the tree, then delivers them to the adequate one (under cursor or keyboard focus based) by calling [method MainLoop._input_event]. There is no need to enable input processing on controls to receive such events. To ensure that no one else will receive the event (not even [method Node._unhandled_input]), the control can accept it by calling [method accept_event]. Only one control can hold the keyboard focus (receiving keyboard events), for that the control must define the focus mode with [method set_focus_mode]. Focus is lost when another control gains it, or the current focus owner is hidden. It is sometimes desired for a control to ignore mouse/pointer events. This is often the case when placing other controls on top of a button, in such cases. Calling [method set_ignore_mouse] enables this function. Finally, controls are skinned according to a [Theme]. Setting a [Theme] on a control will propagate all the skinning down the tree. Optionally, skinning can be overridden per each control by calling the add_*_override functions, or from the editor.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Control.ANCHOR_BEGIN
member.summary: X is relative to MARGIN_LEFT, Y is relative to MARGIN_TOP.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Control.ANCHOR_END
member.summary: X is relative to -MARGIN_RIGHT, Y is relative to -MARGIN_BOTTOM.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Control.FOCUS_NONE

member.summary: Control can acquire focus only if clicked.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Control.FOCUS_ALL

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.accept_event
member.summary: Handles the event, no other control will receive it and it will not be sent to nodes waiting on [method Node._unhandled_input] or [method Node._unhandled_key_input].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_minimum_size
member.summary: Return the minimum size this Control can shrink to. A control will never be displayed or resized smaller than its minimum size.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.set_anchor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the anchor (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) type for a margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Changing the anchor mode converts the current margin offset from the previous anchor mode to the new one, so margin offsets ([method set_margin]) must be done after setting anchors, or at the same time ([method set_anchor_and_margin]) Additionally, [code]keep_margin[/code] controls whether margins should be left the same, or changed to keep the same position and size on-screen.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_anchor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the anchor type (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) for a given margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.set_margin(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Set a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being set depends on the anchor mode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.set_anchor_and_margin(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Change the anchor (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) type for a margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM), and also set its offset. This is a helper (see [method set_anchor] and [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.set_begin(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.set_end(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.set_position(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control, changing all margins if needed and without changing current anchor mode. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.set_size(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Changes MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM to fit a given size. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.set_global_position(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the [i]window[/i] Control, and without changing current anchor mode. (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_margin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being returned depends on the anchor mode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_end
member.summary: Returns MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_position
member.summary: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independent of the anchor mode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_size
member.summary: Returns the size of the Control, computed from all margins, however the size returned will [b]never be smaller than the minimum size reported by[/b] [method get_minimum_size]. This means that even if end position of the Control rectangle is smaller than the begin position, the Control will still display and interact correctly. (see description, [method get_minimum_size], [method set_margin], [method set_anchor]).

member.summary: Return the rotation (in radians)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_rotation_deg

member.summary: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independent of the anchor mode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_rect
member.summary: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method get_position], [method get_size]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.get_global_rect
member.summary: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the [i]window[/i] Control. This is a helper (see [method get_global_position], [method get_size]).

member.summary: Change all margins and anchors, so this Control always takes up the same area as the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method set_anchor], [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Control.show_modal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Display a Control as modal. Control must be a subwindow. Modal controls capture the input signals until closed or the area outside them is accessed. When a modal control loses focus, or the ESC key is pressed, they automatically hide. Modal controls are used extensively for popup dialogs and menus.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ConvexPolygonShape
member.summary: Convex polygon shape resource, which can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or area.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ConvexPolygonShape2D
member.summary: Convex Polygon Shape for 2D physics. A convex polygon, whatever its shape, is internally decomposed into as many convex polygons as needed to ensure all collision checks against it are always done on convex polygons (which are faster to check). The main difference between a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] and a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] is that a concave polygon assumes it is concave and uses a more complex method of collision detection, and a convex one forces itself to be convex in order to speed up collision detection.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConvexPolygonShape2D.set_point_cloud(GodotEngine.Vector2[])
member.summary: Currently, this method does nothing.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConvexPolygonShape2D.set_points(GodotEngine.Vector2[])
member.summary: Set a list of points in either clockwise or counter clockwise order, forming a convex polygon.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ConvexPolygonShape2D.get_points
member.summary: Return a list of points in either clockwise or counter clockwise order, forming a convex polygon.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Curve2D
member.summary: This class describes a Bezier curve in 2D space. It is mainly used to give a shape to a [Path2D], but can be manually sampled for other purposes. It keeps a cache of precalculated points along the curve, to speed further calculations up.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.get_point_count
member.summary: Returns the number of points describing the curve.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.set_point_pos(System.Int32,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position for the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.get_point_pos(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.set_point_in(System.Int32,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.get_point_in(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.set_point_out(System.Int32,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.get_point_out(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.remove_point(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the point "idx" from the curve. Sends an error to the console if "idx" is out of bounds.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.interpolatef(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the position at the vertex "fofs". It calls [method interpolate] using the integer part of fofs as "idx", and its fractional part as "t".

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.set_bake_interval(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance in pixels between two adjacent cached points. Changing it forces the cache to be recomputed the next time a xxx_baked_xxx function is called. The less distance, the more points the cache will have, and the more memory it will consume, so use with care.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.get_bake_interval
member.summary: Returns the distance between two adjacent cached points.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.get_baked_length
member.summary: Returns the total length of the curve, based on the cached points. Given enough density (see [method set_bake_interval]), it should be approximate enough.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.interpolate_baked(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a point within the curve at position "offset", where "offset" is measured as a pixel distance along the curve. To do that, it finds the two cached points where the "offset" lies between, then interpolates the values. This interpolation is cubic if "cubic" is set to true, or linear if set to false. Cubic interpolation tends to follow the curves better, but linear is faster (and often, precise enough).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Curve2D.get_baked_points
member.summary: Returns the cache of points as a [PoolVector2Array].

The tilt controls the rotation along the look-at axis an object traveling the path would have. In the case of a curve controlling a [PathFollow], this tilt is an offset over the natural tilt the PathFollow calculates.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.DampedSpringJoint2D.get_rest_length
member.summary: Return the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.DampedSpringJoint2D.set_stiffness(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.DampedSpringJoint2D.get_stiffness
member.summary: Return the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.DampedSpringJoint2D.set_damping(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.DampedSpringJoint2D.get_damping
member.summary: Return the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

member.name: T:GodotEngine.DirectionalLight
member.summary: A DirectionalLight is a type of [Light] node that emits light constantly in one direction (the negative z axis of the node). It is used lights with strong intensity that are located far away from the scene to model sunlight or moonlight. The worldspace location of the DirectionalLight transform (origin) is ignored, only the basis is used do determine light direction.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.FileDialog
member.summary: FileDialog is a preset dialog used to choose files and directories in the filesystem. It supports filter masks.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_FILE
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of one, and only one file.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_FILES
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of multiple files.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_DIR
member.summary: The dialog functions as a folder selector, disallowing the selection of any file.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_ANY
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of a file or a directory.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.FileDialog.MODE_SAVE_FILE
member.summary: The dialog will warn when a file exists.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.FileDialog.ACCESS_RESOURCES
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of file and directory.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.FileDialog.ACCESS_USERDATA
member.summary: The dialog allows ascess files under [Resource] path(res://) .

member.name: F:GodotEngine.FileDialog.ACCESS_FILESYSTEM
member.summary: The dialog allows ascess files in whole file system.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.clear_filters
member.summary: Clear all the added filters in the dialog.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.add_filter(System.String)
member.summary: Add a custom filter. Filter format is: "mask ; description", example (C++): dialog->add_filter("*.png ; PNG Images");

member.summary: Get the current working directory of the file dialog.

member.summary: Get the current selected file of the file dialog (empty if none).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.get_current_path
member.summary: Get the current selected path (directory and file) of the file dialog (empty if none).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.set_current_dir(System.String)
member.summary: Set the current working directory of the file dialog.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.set_current_file(System.String)
member.summary: Set the current selected file name of the file dialog.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.set_current_path(System.String)
member.summary: Set the current selected file path of the file dialog.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.get_mode

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.set_access(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the file access permission of the dialog(Must be one of [ACCESS_RESOURCES], [ACCESS_USERDATA] or [ACCESS_FILESYSTEM]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.get_access
member.summary: Return the file access permission of the dialog.

member.summary: Set the dialog should show hidden files.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.is_showing_hidden_files
member.summary: Return true if the diaog allows show hidden files.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FileDialog.invalidate
member.summary: Invalidate and update the current dialog content list.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Font
member.summary: Font contains an unicode compatible character set, as well as the ability to draw it with variable width, ascent, descent and kerning. For creating fonts from TTF files (or other font formats), see the editor support for fonts. TODO check wikipedia for graph of ascent/baseline/descent/height/etc.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Font.draw(GodotEngine.RID,GodotEngine.Vector2,System.String,System.Nullable{GodotEngine.Color},System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw "string" into a canvas item using the font at a given "pos" position, with "modulate" color, and optionally clipping the width. "pos" specifies the baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis. If the param is null, then the default value is new Color(1, 1, 1, 1)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Font.get_ascent
member.summary: Return the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Font.get_descent
member.summary: Return the font descent (number of pixels below the baseline).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Font.get_height
member.summary: Return the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Font.get_string_size(System.String)
member.summary: Return the size of a string, taking kerning and advance into account.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Font.draw_char(GodotEngine.RID,GodotEngine.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{GodotEngine.Color})
member.summary: Draw character "char" into a canvas item using the font at a given "pos" position, with "modulate" color, and optionally kerning if "next" is passed. clipping the width. "pos" specifies the baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis. The width used by the character is returned, making this function useful for drawing strings character by character. If the param is null, then the default value is new Color(1, 1, 1, 1)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Font.update_changes
member.summary: After editing a font (changing size, ascent, char rects, etc.). Call this function to propagate changes to controls that might use it.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.FuncRef
member.summary: In GDScript, functions are not [i]first-class objects[/i]. This means it is impossible to store them directly as variables, return them from another function, or pass them as arguments. However, by creating a [FuncRef] using the [method @GDScript.funcref] function, a reference to a function in a given object can be created, passed around and called.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FuncRef.set_instance(GodotEngine.Object)
member.summary: Set the object on which to call the referenced function. This object must be of a type actually inheriting from [Object], not a built-in type such as [int], [Vector2] or [Dictionary].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.FuncRef.set_function(System.String)
member.summary: Set the name of the function to call on the object, without parentheses or any parameters.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.GDFunctionState
member.summary: Calling [method @GDScript.yield] within a function will cause that function to yield and return its current state as an object of this type. The yielded function call can then be resumed later by calling [method resume] on this state object.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GDFunctionState.resume(System.Object)
member.summary: Resume execution of the yielded function call. If handed an argument, return the argument from the [method @GDScript.yield] call in the yielded function call. You can pass e.g. an [Array] to hand multiple arguments. This function returns what the resumed function call returns, possibly another function state if yielded again.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GDFunctionState.is_valid(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check whether the function call may be resumed. This is not the case if the function state was already resumed. If [code]extended_check[/code] is enabled, it also checks if the associated script and object still exist. The extended check is done in debug mode as part of [method GDFunctionState.resume], but you can use this if you know you may be trying to resume without knowing for sure the object and/or script have survived up to that point.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.GeometryInstance
member.summary: Base node for geometry based visual instances. Shares some common functionality like visibility and custom materials.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GeometryInstance.get_material_override
member.summary: Return the material override for the whole geometry.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Gradient
member.summary: Given a set of colors, this node will interpolate them in order, meaning, that if you have color 1, color 2 and color3, the ramp will interpolate (generate the colors between two colors) from color 1 to color 2 and from color 2 to color 3. Initially the ramp will have 2 colors (black and white), one (black) at ramp lower offset offset 0 and the other (white) at the ramp higher offset 1.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.add_point(System.Single,GodotEngine.Color)
member.summary: Adds the specified color to the end of the ramp, with the specified offset

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.remove_point(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the color at the index [i]offset[/i]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.set_offset(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the offset for the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.get_offset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the offset of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.set_color(System.Int32,GodotEngine.Color)
member.summary: Sets the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.get_color(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.interpolate(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the interpolated color specified by [i]offset[/i]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.get_point_count
member.summary: Returns the number of colors in the ramp

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.set_offsets(System.Single[])
member.summary: Sets the offset for the specified amount of elements. Calling this function with a different number of elements than previously defined causes the ramp to resize its colors and offsets array to accommodate the new elements, all new colors will be black by default.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.get_offsets
member.summary: Returns the offsets for the colors in this ramp

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.set_colors(GodotEngine.Color[])
member.summary: Sets the colors for the specified amount of elements. Calling this function with a different number of elements than previously defined causes the ramp to resize its colors and offsets array to accommodate the new elements.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Gradient.get_colors
member.summary: Returns the colors in the ramp

member.name: T:GodotEngine.GraphEdit
member.summary: GraphEdit manages the showing of GraphNodes it contains, as well as connections an disconnections between them. Signals are sent for each of these two events. Disconnection between GraphNodes slots is disabled by default. It is greatly advised to enable low processor usage mode (see [method OS.set_low_processor_usage_mode]) when using GraphEdits.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.connect_node(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a connection between 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode. If the connection already exists, no connection is created.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.is_node_connected(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return true if the 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode is connected to the 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.disconnect_node(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove the connection between 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode, if connection exists.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.get_connection_list
member.summary: Return an Array containing the list of connections. A connection consists in a structure of the form {from_slot: 0, from: "GraphNode name 0", to_slot: 1, to: "GraphNode name 1" }

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.get_scroll_ofs
member.summary: Return the scroll offset.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.set_zoom(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the zoom value of the GraphEdit. Zoom value is between [0.01; 1.728].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.get_zoom
member.summary: Return the current zoom value.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.set_right_disconnects(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable the disconnection of existing connections in the visual GraphEdit by left-clicking a connection and releasing into the void.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphEdit.is_right_disconnects_enabled
member.summary: Return true is the disconnection of connections is enable in the visual GraphEdit. False otherwise.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.GraphNode
member.summary: A GraphNode is a container defined by a title. It can have 1 or more input and output slots, which can be enabled (shown) or disabled (not shown) and have different (incompatible) types. Colors can also be assigned to slots. A tuple of input and output slots is defined for each GUI element included in the GraphNode. Input and output connections are left and right slots, but only enabled slots are counted as connections.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphNode.set_title(System.String)
member.summary: Set the title of the GraphNode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GraphNode.get_title

member.name: T:GodotEngine.GridContainer
member.summary: Grid container will arrange its children in a grid like structure, the grid columns are specified using the [method set_columns] method and the number of rows will be equal to the number of children in the container divided by the number of columns, for example: if the container has 5 children, and 2 columns, there will be 3 rows in the container. Notice that grid layout will preserve the columns and rows for every size of the container.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GridContainer.set_columns(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the numbers of columns in the container, then reorder its children to accommodate the new layout

member.name: M:GodotEngine.GridContainer.get_columns
member.summary: Returns the number of columns in this container

member.name: T:GodotEngine.HTTPClient
member.summary: Hyper-text transfer protocol client. Supports SSL and SSL server certificate verification. Can be reused to connect to different hosts and make many requests.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.connect_to_host(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connect to a host. This needs to be done before any requests are sent. The host should not have http:// prepended but will strip the protocol identifier if provided. verify_host will check the SSL identity of the host if set to true.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.set_connection(GodotEngine.StreamPeer)
member.summary: Set connection to use, for this client.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.get_connection
member.summary: Return current connection.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.request_raw(System.Int32,System.String,System.String[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends a raw request to the connected host. The url is what is normally behind the hostname, i.e. in [code]http://somehost.com/index.php[/code], url would be "index.php". Headers are HTTP request headers. Sends body raw, as a byte array, does not encode it in any way.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.request(System.Int32,System.String,System.String[],System.String)
M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.send_body_text(System.String)
member.summary: Stub function

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.send_body_data(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Stub function

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.close
member.summary: Cloces the current connection, allows for reusal of [HTTPClient].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.get_response_headers_as_dictionary
member.summary: Returns all response headers as dictionary where the case-sensitivity of the keys and values is kept like the server delivers it. A value is a simple String, this string can have more than one value where "; " is used as separator. Structure: ("key":"value1; value2") Example: (content-length:12), (Content-Type:application/json; charset=UTF-8)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.HTTPClient.get_response_body_length

member.name: T:GodotEngine.IP
member.summary: IP contains some support functions for the IPv4 protocol. TCP/IP support is in different classes (see [StreamPeerTCP] and [TCP_Server]). IP provides hostname resolution support, both blocking and threaded.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.IP.resolve_hostname(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resolve a given hostname, blocking. Resolved hostname is returned as an IPv4 or IPv6 depending on "ip_type".

member.name: M:GodotEngine.IP.resolve_hostname_queue_item(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a queue item for resolving a given hostname to an IPv4 or IPv6 depending on "ip_type". The queue ID is returned, or RESOLVER_INVALID_ID on error.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.IP.get_resolve_item_status(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the status of hostname queued for resolving, given its queue ID. Returned status can be any of the RESOLVER_STATUS_* enumeration.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.IP.get_resolve_item_address(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a resolved item address, or an empty string if an error happened or resolution didn't happen yet (see [method get_resolve_item_status]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.IP.erase_resolve_item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Erase a queue ID, removing it from the queue if needed. This should be used after a queue is completed to free it and enable more queries to happen.

member.summary: Blits a "src_rect" [Rect2] from "src" [Image] to this [Image] using a "mask" [Image] on coordinates "dest". Alpha channel is required for "mask", will copy src pixel onto dest if the corresponding mask pixel's alpha value is not 0. "src" [Image] and "mask" [Image] *must* have the same size (width and height) but they can have different formats

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Image.blend_rect(GodotEngine.Image,GodotEngine.Rect2,GodotEngine.Vector2)

member.summary: Alpha-blends a "src_rect" [Rect2] from "src" [Image] to this [Image] using a "mask" [Image] on coordinates "dest". Alpha channels are required for both "src" and "mask", dest pixels and src pixels will blend if the corresponding mask pixel's alpha value is not 0. "src" [Image] and "mask" [Image] *must* have the same size (width and height) but they can have different formats

member.summary: A Singleton that deals with inputs. This includes key presses, mouse buttons and movement, joypads, and input actions.

member.summary: Makes the mouse cursor hidden if it is visible.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Input.MOUSE_MODE_CAPTURED
member.summary: Captures the mouse. The mouse will be hidden and unable to leave the game window. But it will still register movement and mouse button presses.

member.summary: Returns if the joypad button at the given index is currently pressed. (see JOY_* constants in [@Global Scope])

member.summary: Returns true or false depending on whether the action event is pressed. Actions and their events can be set in the Project Settings / Input Map tab. Or be set with [InputMap].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.add_joy_mapping(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a new mapping entry (in SDL2 format) to the mapping database. Optionally update already connected devices.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.remove_joy_mapping(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all mappings from the internal db that match the given uid.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.is_joy_known(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the specified device is known by the system. This means that it sets all button and axis indices exactly as defined in the JOY_* constants (see [@Global Scope]). Unknown joypads are not expected to match these constants, but you can still retrieve events from them.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.get_joy_axis(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the current value of the joypad axis at given index (see JOY_* constants in [@Global Scope])

member.summary: Returns the name of the joypad at the specified device index

member.summary: Returns a SDL2 compatible device guid on platforms that use gamepad remapping. Returns "Default Gamepad" otherwise.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.get_connected_joypads
member.summary: Returns an [Array] containing the device IDs of all currently connected joypads.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.get_joy_vibration_strength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the strength of the joypad vibration: x is the strength of the weak motor, and y is the strength of the strong motor.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.get_joy_vibration_duration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the duration of the current vibration effect in seconds.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.start_joy_vibration(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Starts to vibrate the joypad. Joypads usually come with two rumble motors, a strong and a weak one. weak_magnitude is the strength of the weak motor (between 0 and 1) and strong_magnitude is the strength of the strong motor (between 0 and 1). duration is the duration of the effect in seconds (a duration of 0 will try to play the vibration indefinitely). Note that not every hardware is compatible with long effect durations, it is recommended to restart an effect if in need to play it for more than a few seconds.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.stop_joy_vibration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops the vibration of the joypad.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Input.get_gyroscope
member.summary: If the device has a gyroscope, this will return the rate of rotation in rad/s around a device's x, y, and z axis.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.InstancePlaceholder
member.summary: Turning on the option [b]Load As Placeholder[/b] for an instanced scene in the editor causes it to be replaced by an InstacePlaceholder when running the game. This makes it possible to delay actually loading the scene until calling [method replace_by_instance]. This is useful to avoid loading large scenes all at once by loading parts of it selectively. The InstancePlaceholder does not have a transform. This causes any child nodes to be positioned relatively to the Viewport from point (0,0), rather than their parent as displayed in the editor. Replacing the placeholder with a scene with a transform will transform children relatively to their parent again.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.InstancePlaceholder.replace_by_instance(GodotEngine.PackedScene)
member.summary: Replace this placeholder by the scene handed as an argument, or the original scene if no argument is given. As for all resources, the scene is loaded only if it's not loaded already. By manually loading the scene beforehand, delays caused by this function can be avoided.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.InstancePlaceholder.get_instance_path
member.summary: Retrieve the path to the [PackedScene] resource file that is loaded by default when calling [method replace_by_instance].

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ItemList
member.summary: This control provides a selectable list of items that may be in a single (or multiple columns) with option of text, icons, or both text and icon. Tooltips are supported and may be different for every item in the list. Selectable items in the list may be selected or deselected and multiple selection may be enabled. Selection with right mouse button may also be enabled to allow use of popup context menus. Items may also be 'activated' with a double click (or Enter key).

member.name: T:GodotEngine.KinematicBody
member.summary: Kinematic bodies are special types of bodies that are meant to be user-controlled. They are not affected by physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigid body, these are the same as a static body). They have however, two main uses: Simulated Motion: When these bodies are moved manually, either from code or from an AnimationPlayer (with process mode set to fixed), the physics will automatically compute an estimate of their linear and angular velocity. This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc). Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody also has an api for moving objects (the [method move] method) while performing collision tests. This makes them really useful to implement characters that collide against a world, but that don't require advanced physics.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.KinematicBody.move(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Move the body in the given direction, stopping if there is an obstacle. If as a result of a movement there will be any collision then informations about this collision will be in returned dictionary. Dictionary will contains those keys: - "position" - collision position - "normal" - collision normal - "local_shape" - id of this kinematic body shape that took part in a collision - "travel" - traveled movement before being stopped - "remainder" - remaining movement before being stopped - "collider_id" - id of the collider, it can be used when dealing with [PhysicsServer] - "collider" - colliding body - "collider_shape_index" - index of the colliding shape, inside collider body "collider_metadata" If the body did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead. Please note that this method is less user friendly than [method move_and_slide]. If you don't want to program each edge case manually, then it's recommended to use [method move_and_slide] instead.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.KinematicBody2D
member.summary: Kinematic bodies are special types of bodies that are meant to be user-controlled. They are not affected by physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigid body, these are the same as a static body). They have however, two main uses: Simulated Motion: When these bodies are moved manually, either from code or from an AnimationPlayer (with process mode set to fixed), the physics will automatically compute an estimate of their linear and angular velocity. This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc). Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody2D also has an api for moving objects (the [method move] method) while performing collision tests. This makes them really useful to implement characters that collide against a world, but that don't require advanced physics.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.KinematicBody2D.move(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Move the body in the given direction, stopping if there is an obstacle. If as a result of a movement there will be any collision then informations about this collision will be in returned dictionary. Dictionary will contains those keys: - "position" - collision position - "normal" - collision normal - "local_shape" - id of this kinematic body shape that took part in a collision - "travel" - traveled movement before being stopped - "remainder" - remaining movement before being stopped - "collider_id" - id of the collider, it can be used when dealing with [Physics2DServer] - "collider" - colliding body - "collider_shape_index" - index of the colliding shape, inside collider body "collider_metadata" If the body did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead. Please note that this method is less user friendly than [method move_and_slide]. If you don't want to program each edge case manually, then it's recommended to use [method move_and_slide] instead.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.KinematicBody2D.test_move(GodotEngine.Transform2D,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Return true if there would be a collision if the body moved from the given point in the given direction.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.KinematicBody2D.get_collision_collider_velocity(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the velocity of the body that collided with this one.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Light
member.summary: Light is the abstract base class for light nodes, so it shouldn't be used directly (It can't be instanced). Other types of light nodes inherit from it. Light contains the common variables and parameters used for lighting.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Light2D
member.summary: Node that casts light in a 2D environment. Light is defined by a (usually grayscale) texture, a color, an energy value, a mode (see constants), and various other parameters (range and shadows-related). Note that Light2D can be used as a mask.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Light2D.MODE_ADD
member.summary: Adds the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it. This is the common behaviour of a light.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Light2D.MODE_SUB
member.summary: Subtract the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it, resulting in inversed light effect.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Light2D.MODE_MIX
member.summary: Mix the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it by linear interpolation.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Light2D.MODE_MASK
member.summary: The light texture of the Light2D is used as a mask, hiding or revealing parts of the screen underneath depending on the value of each pixel of the light (mask) texture.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.MainLoop
member.summary: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class. All other main loop classes are derived from it. Upon application start, a [MainLoop] has to be provided to OS, else the application will exit. This happens automatically (and a [SceneTree] is created), unless a main [Script] is supplied, which may or not create and return a [MainLoop].

member.name: T:GodotEngine.MarginContainer
member.summary: Simple margin container. Adds a left margin to anything contained.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Material
member.summary: Material is a base [Resource] used for coloring and shading geometry. All materials inherit from it and almost all [VisualInstance] derived nodes carry a Material. A few flags and parameters are shared between all material types and are configured here.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.MenuButton

member.name: M:GodotEngine.MenuButton.get_popup
member.summary: Return the [PopupMenu] contained in this button.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Mesh
member.summary: Mesh is a type of [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry, divided in [i]surfaces[/i]. Each surface contains a completely separate array and a material used to draw it. Design wise, a mesh with multiple surfaces is preferred to a single surface, because objects created in 3D editing software commonly contain multiple materials.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Mesh.PRIMITIVE_POINTS
member.summary: Render array as points (one vertex equals one point).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Mesh.PRIMITIVE_LINES
member.summary: Render array as lines (every two vertices a line is created).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Mesh.PRIMITIVE_LINE_STRIP
member.summary: Render array as line strip.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Mesh.PRIMITIVE_LINE_LOOP
member.summary: Render array as line loop (like line strip, but closed).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES
member.summary: Render array as triangles (every three vertices a triangle is created).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_STRIP
member.summary: Render array as triangle strips.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_FAN
member.summary: Render array as triangle fans.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.MeshInstance
member.summary: MeshInstance is a [Node] that takes a [Mesh] resource and adds it to the current scenario by creating an instance of it. This is the class most often used to get 3D geometry rendered and can be used to instance a single [Mesh] in many places. This allows to reuse geometry and save on resources. When a [Mesh] has to be instanced more than thousands of times at close proximity, consider using a [MultiMesh] in a [MultiMeshInstance] instead.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.MeshInstance.create_trimesh_collision
member.summary: This helper creates a [StaticBody] child [Node] using the mesh geometry as collision. It's mainly used for testing.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.MultiMesh
member.summary: MultiMesh provides low level mesh instancing. If the amount of [Mesh] instances needed goes from hundreds to thousands (and most need to be visible at close proximity) creating such a large amount of [MeshInstance] nodes may affect performance by using too much CPU or video memory. For this case a MultiMesh becomes very useful, as it can draw thousands of instances with little API overhead. As a drawback, if the instances are too far away of each other, performance may be reduced as every single instance will always rendered (they are spatially indexed as one, for the whole object). Since instances may have any behavior, the Rect3 used for visibility must be provided by the user.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.MultiMesh.get_instance_count
member.summary: Return the amount of instances that is going to be drawn.

member.summary: Set the transform for a specific instance.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.MultiMesh.get_instance_transform(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the transform of a specific instance.
