member.name: T:GodotEngine.NetworkedMultiplayerENet
member.summary: A connection (or a listening server) that should be passed to [method SceneTree.set_network_peer]. Socket events can be handled by connecting to [SceneTree] signals.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Node
member.summary: Nodes are the base bricks with which Godot games are developed. They can be set as children of other nodes, resulting in a tree arrangement. A given node can contain any number of nodes as children (but there is only one scene tree root node) with the requirement that all siblings (direct children of a node) should have unique names. Any tree of nodes is called a [i]scene[/i]. Scenes can be saved to the disk and then instanced into other scenes. This allows for very high flexibility in the architecture and data model of the projects. Nodes can optionally be added to groups. This makes it easy to reach a number of nodes from the code (for example an "enemies" group) to perform grouped actions. [b]Scene tree:[/b] The [SceneTree] contains the active tree of nodes. When a node is added to the scene tree, it receives the NOTIFICATION_ENTER_TREE notification and its [method _enter_tree] callback is triggered. Children nodes are always added [i]after[/i] their parent node, i.e. the [method _enter_tree] callback of a parent node will be triggered before its child's. Once all nodes have been added in the scene tree, they receive the NOTIFICATION_READY notification and their respective [method _ready] callbacks are triggered. For groups of nodes, the [method _ready] callback is called in reverse order, from the children up to the parent nodes. It means that when adding a scene to the scene tree, the following order will be used for the callbacks: [method _enter_tree] of the parent, [method _enter_tree] of the children, [method _ready] of the children and finally [method _ready] of the parent (and that recursively for the whole scene). [b]Processing:[/b] Nodes can be set to the "process" state, so that they receive a callback on each frame requesting them to process (do something). Normal processing (callback [method _process], toggled with [method set_process]) happens as fast as possible and is dependent on the frame rate, so the processing time [i]delta[/i] is variable. Fixed processing (callback [method _fixed_process], toggled with [method set_fixed_process]) happens a fixed amount of times per second (by default 60) and is useful to link itself to the physics. Nodes can also process input events. When set, the [method _input] function will be called for each input that the program receives. In many cases, this can be overkill (unless used for simple projects), and the [method _unhandled_input] function might be preferred; it is called when the input event was not handled by anyone else (typically, GUI [Control] nodes), ensuring that the node only receives the events that were meant for it. To keep track of the scene hierarchy (especially when instancing scenes into other scenes), an "owner" can be set for the node with [method set_owner]. This keeps track of who instanced what. This is mostly useful when writing editors and tools, though. Finally, when a node is freed with [method free] or [method queue_free], it will also free all its children. [b]Networking with nodes:[/b] After connecting to a server (or making one, see [NetworkedMultiplayerENet]) it is possible to use the built-in RPC (remote procedure call) system to easily communicate over the network. By calling [method rpc] with a method name, it will be called locally, and in all connected peers (peers = clients and the server that accepts connections), with behaviour varying depending on the network mode ([method set_network_mode]) on the receiving peer. To identify which [Node] receives the RPC call Godot will use its [NodePath] (make sure node names are the same on all peers).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Node.NOTIFICATION_PROCESS
member.summary: Notification received every frame when the process flag is set (see [method set_process]).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Node.NOTIFICATION_PARENTED
member.summary: Notification received when a node is set as a child of another node. Note that this doesn't mean that a node entered the Scene Tree.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Node.NOTIFICATION_UNPARENTED
member.summary: Notification received when a node is unparented (parent removed it from the list of children).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.set_name(System.String)
member.summary: Set the name of the [Node]. Name must be unique within parent, and setting an already existing name will cause for the node to be automatically renamed.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_name
member.summary: Return the name of the node. This name is unique among the siblings (other child nodes from the same parent).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.add_child(GodotEngine.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a child [Node]. Nodes can have as many children as they want, but every child must have a unique name. Children nodes are automatically deleted when the parent node is deleted, so deleting a whole scene is performed by deleting its topmost node. The optional boolean argument enforces creating child nodes with human-readable names, based on the name of the node being instanced instead of its type only.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.remove_child(GodotEngine.Node)
member.summary: Remove a child [Node]. Node is NOT deleted and will have to be deleted manually.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_child_count
member.summary: Return the amount of child nodes.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_children
member.summary: Return an array of references ([Node]) to the child nodes.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_child(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a child node by its index (see [method get_child_count]). This method is often used for iterating all children of a node.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_node(GodotEngine.NodePath)
member.summary: Fetch a node. The [NodePath] must be valid (or else an error will be raised) and can be either the path to child node, a relative path (from the current node to another node), or an absolute path to a node. Note: fetching absolute paths only works when the node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]). [i]Example:[/i] Assume your current node is Character and the following tree: [codeblock] /root /root/Character /root/Character/Sword /root/Character/Backpack/Dagger /root/MyGame /root/Swamp/Alligator /root/Swamp/Mosquito /root/Swamp/Goblin [/codeblock] Possible paths are: [codeblock] get_node("Sword") get_node("Backpack/Dagger") get_node("../Swamp/Alligator") get_node("/root/MyGame") [/codeblock]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_parent
member.summary: Return the parent node of the current node, or an empty [Node] if the node lacks a parent.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.find_node(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find a descendant of this node whose name matches [code]mask[/code] as in [method String.match] (i.e. case sensitive, but '*' matches zero or more characters and '?' matches any single character except '.'). Note that it does not match against the full path, just against individual node names.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.is_a_parent_of(GodotEngine.Node)
member.summary: Return [i]true[/i] if the "node" argument is a direct or indirect child of the current node, otherwise return [i]false[/i].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.is_greater_than(GodotEngine.Node)
member.summary: Return [i]true[/i] if "node" occurs later in the scene hierarchy than the current node, otherwise return [i]false[/i].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_path
member.summary: Return the absolute path of the current node. This only works if the current node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_path_to(GodotEngine.Node)
member.summary: Return the relative path from the current node to the specified node in "node" argument. Both nodes must be in the same scene, or else the function will fail.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.add_to_group(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a node to a group. Groups are helpers to name and organize a subset of nodes, like for example "enemies" or "collectables". A [Node] can be in any number of groups. Nodes can be assigned a group at any time, but will not be added to it until they are inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.remove_from_group(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a node from a group.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.move_child(GodotEngine.Node,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move a child node to a different position (order) amongst the other children. Since calls, signals, etc are performed by tree order, changing the order of children nodes may be useful.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_groups
member.summary: Return an array listing the groups that the node is part of.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.raise
member.summary: Move this node to the top of the array of nodes of the parent node. This is often useful on GUIs ([Control]), because their order of drawing fully depends on their order in the tree.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.set_owner(GodotEngine.Node)
member.summary: Set the node owner. A node can have any other node as owner (as long as a valid parent, grandparent, etc ascending in the tree). When saving a node (using SceneSaver) all the nodes it owns will be saved with it. This allows to create complex SceneTrees, with instancing and subinstancing.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_owner
member.summary: Get the node owner (see [method set_owner]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.remove_and_skip
member.summary: Remove a node and set all its children as children of the parent node (if exists). All even subscriptions that pass by the removed node will be unsubscribed.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_index
member.summary: Get the node index, i.e. its position among the siblings of its parent.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.print_tree
member.summary: Print the scene to stdout. Used mainly for debugging purposes.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.set_filename(System.String)
member.summary: A node can contain a filename. This filename should not be changed by the user, unless writing editors and tools. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_filename
member.summary: Return a filename that may be contained by the node. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded (see [method set_filename]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.propagate_notification(System.Int32)
member.summary: Notify the current node and all its children recursively by calling notification() in all of them.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.set_fixed_process(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables node fixed framerate processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS at a fixed (usually 60 fps, check [OS] to change that) interval (and the [method _fixed_process] callback will be called if exists). It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_fixed_process_delta_time].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_fixed_process_delta_time
member.summary: Return the time elapsed since the last fixed frame (see [method _fixed_process]). This is always the same in fixed processing unless the frames per second is changed in [OS].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.is_fixed_processing
member.summary: Return true if fixed processing is enabled (see [method set_fixed_process]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.get_process_delta_time
member.summary: Return the time elapsed (in seconds) since the last process callback. This is almost always different each time.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.set_process(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables node processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS on every drawn frame (and the [method _process] callback will be called if exists). It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_process_delta_time].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.is_processing
member.summary: Return whether processing is enabled in the current node (see [method set_process]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.set_process_input(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable input processing for node. This is not required for GUI controls! It hooks up the node to receive all input (see [method _input]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.is_processing_input
member.summary: Return true if the node is processing input (see [method set_process_input]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.set_process_unhandled_input(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable unhandled input processing for node. This is not required for GUI controls! It hooks up the node to receive all input that was not previously handled before (usually by a [Control]). (see [method _unhandled_input]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.is_processing_unhandled_input
member.summary: Return true if the node is processing unhandled input (see [method set_process_unhandled_input]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Node.can_process
member.summary: Return true if the node can process, i.e. whether its pause mode allows processing while the scene tree is paused (see [method set_pause_mode]). Always returns true if the scene tree is not paused, and false if the node is not in the tree. FIXME: Why FAIL_COND?

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Object
member.summary: Base class for all non built-in types. Everything not a built-in type starts the inheritance chain from this class. Objects do not manage memory, if inheriting from one the object will most likely have to be deleted manually (call the [method free] function from the script or delete from C++). Some derivates add memory management, such as [Reference] (which keeps a reference count and deletes itself automatically when no longer referenced) and [Node], which deletes the children tree when deleted. Objects export properties, which are mainly useful for storage and editing, but not really so much in programming. Properties are exported in [method _get_property_list] and handled in [method _get] and [method _set]. However, scripting languages and C++ have simpler means to export them. Objects also receive notifications ([method _notification]). Notifications are a simple way to notify the object about simple events, so they can all be handled together.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Object.NOTIFICATION_POSTINITIALIZE
member.summary: Called right when the object is initialized. Not available in script.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Object.NOTIFICATION_PREDELETE
member.summary: Called before the object is about to be deleted.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Object.CONNECT_DEFERRED
member.summary: Connect a signal in deferred mode. This way, signal emissions are stored in a queue, then set on idle time.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Object.CONNECT_PERSIST
member.summary: Persisting connections are saved when the object is serialized to file.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Object.CONNECT_ONESHOT
member.summary: One shot connections disconnect themselves after emission.

member.summary: Add a user signal (can be added anytime). Arguments are optional, but can be added as an array of dictionaries, each containing "name" and "type" (from [@Global Scope] TYPE_*). If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Object.get_incoming_connections
member.summary: Returns an [Array] of dictionaries with informations about signals that are connected to this object. Inside each [Dictionary] there are 3 fields: - "source" is a reference to signal emitter. - "signal_name" is name of connected signal. - "method_name" is a name of method to which signal is connected.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Object.connect(System.String,GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Connect a signal to a method at a target (member function). Binds are optional and are passed as extra arguments to the call. Flags specify optional deferred or one shot connections, see enum CONNECT_*. A signal can only be connected once to a method, and it will throw an error if already connected. If you want to avoid this, use [method is_connected] to check. If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PacketPeer
member.summary: PacketPeer is an abstraction and base class for packet-based protocols (such as UDP). It provides an API for sending and receiving packets both as raw data or variables. This makes it easy to transfer data over a protocol, without having to encode data as low level bytes or having to worry about network ordering.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeer.get_var
member.summary: Get a Variant.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeer.put_var(System.Object)
member.summary: Send a Variant as a packet.

member.summary: Get a raw packet.

member.summary: Send a raw packet.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeer.get_packet_error
member.summary: Return the error state of the last packet received (via [method get_packet] and [method get_var]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeer.get_available_packet_count
member.summary: Return the number of packets currently available in the ring-buffer.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PacketPeerStream
member.summary: PacketStreamPeer provides a wrapper for working using packets over a stream. This allows for using packet based code with StreamPeers. PacketPeerStream implements a custom protocol over the StreamPeer, so the user should not read or write to the wrapped StreamPeer directly.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PacketPeerUDP
member.summary: UDP packet peer. Can be used to send raw UDP packets as well as [Variant]\ s.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeerUDP.listen(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Make this [PacketPeerUDP] listen on the "port" binding to "bind_address" with a buffer size "recv_buf_size". If "bind_address" is set as "*" (default), the peer will listen on all available addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6). If "bind_address" is set as "0.0.0.0" (for IPv4) or "::" (for IPv6), the peer will listen on all available addresses matching that IP type. If "bind_address" is set to any valid address (e.g. "192.168.1.101", "::1", etc), the peer will only listen on the interface with that addresses (or fail if no interface with the given address exists).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeerUDP.close
member.summary: Close the UDP socket the [PacketPeerUDP] is currently listening on.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeerUDP.wait
member.summary: Wait for a packet to arrive on the listening port, see [method listen].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeerUDP.is_listening
member.summary: Return whether this [PacketPeerUDP] is listening.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeerUDP.get_packet_ip
member.summary: Return the IP of the remote peer that sent the last packet(that was received with [method get_packet] or [method get_var]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeerUDP.get_packet_port
member.summary: Return the port of the remote peer that sent the last packet(that was received with [method get_packet] or [method get_var]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PacketPeerUDP.set_dest_address(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the destination address and port for sending packets and variables, a hostname will be resolved using if valid.

member.summary: Set the left and top limits in pixels for scrolling to begin. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will not continue to scroll. If an axis is greater than or equal to the corresponding axis of limit_end, then it will not limit scrolling for that axis.

member.summary: Return the beginning limit.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ParallaxBackground.set_limit_end(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the right and bottom limits in pixels for scrolling to end. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will not continue to scroll. If an axis is less than or equal to the corresponding axis of limit_begin, then it will not limit scrolling for that axis.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ParallaxBackground.get_limit_end
member.summary: Return the ending limit.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ParallaxBackground.set_ignore_camera_zoom(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set to true for all child [ParallaxLayer] nodes to not be affected by the zoom level of the camera.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ParallaxBackground.is_ignore_camera_zoom
member.summary: Return ignoring camera zoom.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ParallaxLayer
member.summary: A ParallaxLayer must be the child of a [ParallaxBackground] node. All child nodes will be affected by the parallax scrolling of this layer.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ParallaxLayer.set_motion_scale(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the motion scale of the ParallaxLayer. If an axis is set to 0 then it will not move at all, it will stick with the camera.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ParallaxLayer.get_motion_scale

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ParallaxLayer.set_mirroring(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the mirroring of the ParallaxLayer. If an axis is set to 0 then that axis will have no mirroring.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ParallaxLayer.get_mirroring

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Particles2D
member.summary: Particles2D is a particle system 2D [Node] that is used to simulate several types of particle effects, such as explosions, rain, snow, fireflies, or other magical-like shinny sparkles. Particles are drawn using impostors, and given their dynamic behavior, the user must provide a visibility bounding box (although helpers to create one automatically exist).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Particles2D.set_emitting(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If this is set to true then the particle emitter will emit particles, if its false it will not.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Particles2D.set_amount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the amount of particles spawned at each emission

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Particles2D.set_lifetime(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the amount of seconds that each particle will be visible.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Particles2D.is_emitting
member.summary: Returns whether this emitter is currently emitting or not

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Particles2D.get_amount
member.summary: Returns the amount of particles spawned at each emission

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Particles2D.get_lifetime
member.summary: Gets the amount of seconds that each particle will be visible.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Particles2D.get_texture
member.summary: Returns the texture for emitted particles

member.summary: This class is a container/Node-ification of a [Curve3D], so it can have [Spatial] properties and [Node] info.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Path.set_curve(GodotEngine.Curve3D)
member.summary: Sets the [Curve3D].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Path.get_curve
member.summary: Returns the [Curve3D] contained.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Path2D
member.summary: This class is a container/Node-ification of a [Curve2D], so it can have [Node2D] properties and [Node] info.

member.summary: Sets the [Curve2D].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Path2D.get_curve
member.summary: Returns the [Curve2D] contained.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PathFollow
member.summary: This node takes its parent [Path], and returns the coordinates of a point within it, given a distance from the first vertex. It is useful for making other nodes follow a path, without coding the movement pattern. For that, the nodes must be descendants of this node. Then, when setting an offset in this node, the descendant nodes will move accordingly.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PathFollow.ROTATION_NONE
member.summary: Forbids the PathFollow to rotate.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PathFollow.ROTATION_Y
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in the Y axis only.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PathFollow.ROTATION_XY
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in both the X, and Y axes.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PathFollow.ROTATION_XYZ
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in any axis.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.set_offset(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the first vertex, measured in 3D units along the path. This sets this node's position to a point within the path.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.get_offset
member.summary: Returns the distance along the path in 3D units.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.set_h_offset(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves this node in the X axis. As this node's position will be set every time its offset is set, this allows many PathFollow to share the same curve (and thus the same movement pattern), yet not return the same position for a given path offset. A similar effect may be achieved moving the this node's descendants.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.get_h_offset
member.summary: Returns the X displacement this node has from its parent [Path].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.set_v_offset(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves this node in the Y axis, for the same reasons of [method set_h_offset].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.get_v_offset
member.summary: Returns the Y displacement this node has from its parent [Path].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.set_unit_offset(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the first vertex, considering 0.0 as the first vertex and 1.0 as the last. This is just another way of expressing the offset within the path, as the offset supplied is multiplied internally by the path's length.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.get_unit_offset
member.summary: Returns the distance along the path as a number in the range 0.0 (for the first vertex) to 1.0 (for the last).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.set_rotation_mode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows or forbids rotation on one or more axes, per the constants below.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.get_rotation_mode
member.summary: Returns the rotation mode. The constants below list which axes are allowed to rotate for each mode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.set_cubic_interpolation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The points along the [Curve3D] of the [Path] are precomputed before use, for faster calculations. The point at the requested offset is then calculated interpolating between two adjacent cached points. This may present a problem if the curve makes sharp turns, as the cached points may not follow the curve closely enough. There are two answers to this problem: Either increase the number of cached points and increase memory consumption, or make a cubic interpolation between two points at the cost of (slightly) slower calculations. This method controls whether the position between two cached points is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.get_cubic_interpolation
member.summary: This method returns whether the position between two cached points (see [method set_cubic_interpolation]) is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.set_loop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, any offset outside the path's length (whether set by [method set_offset] or [method set_unit_offset] will wrap around, instead of stopping at the ends. Set it for cyclic paths.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow.has_loop
member.summary: Returns whether this node wraps its offsets around, or truncates them to the path ends.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D
member.summary: This node takes its parent [Path2D], and returns the coordinates of a point within it, given a distance from the first vertex. It is useful for making other nodes follow a path, without coding the movement pattern. For that, the nodes must be descendants of this node. Then, when setting an offset in this node, the descendant nodes will move accordingly.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.set_offset(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the first vertex, measured in pixels along the path. This sets this node's position to a point within the path.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.get_offset
member.summary: Returns the distance along the path in pixels.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.set_h_offset(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves this node horizontally. As this node's position will be set every time its offset is set, this allows many PathFollow2D to share the same curve (and thus the same movement pattern), yet not return the same position for a given path offset. A similar effect may be achieved moving this node's descendants.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.get_h_offset
member.summary: Returns the horizontal displacement this node has from its parent [Path2D].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.set_v_offset(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves the PathFollow2D vertically, for the same reasons of [method set_h_offset].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.get_v_offset
member.summary: Returns the vertical displacement this node has from its parent [Path2D].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.set_unit_offset(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the first vertex, considering 0.0 as the first vertex and 1.0 as the last. This is just another way of expressing the offset within the path, as the offset supplied is multiplied internally by the path's length.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.get_unit_offset
member.summary: Returns the distance along the path as a number in the range 0.0 (for the first vertex) to 1.0 (for the last).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.set_rotate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, this node rotates to follow the path, making its descendants rotate.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.is_rotating
member.summary: Returns whether this node rotates to follow the path.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.set_cubic_interpolation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The points along the [Curve2D] of the [Path2D] are precomputed before use, for faster calculations. The point at the requested offset is then calculated interpolating between two adjacent cached points. This may present a problem if the curve makes sharp turns, as the cached points may not follow the curve closely enough. There are two answers to this problem: Either increase the number of cached points and increase memory consumption, or make a cubic interpolation between two points at the cost of (slightly) slower calculations. This method controls whether the position between two cached points is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.get_cubic_interpolation
member.summary: This method returns whether the position between two cached points (see [method set_cubic_interpolation]) is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.set_loop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, any offset outside the path's length (whether set by [method set_offset] or [method set_unit_offset] will wrap around, instead of stopping at the ends. Set it for cyclic paths.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PathFollow2D.has_loop
member.summary: Returns whether this node wraps its offsets around, or truncates them to the path ends.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState
member.summary: Direct access object to a physics body in the [Physics2DServer]. This object is passed via the direct state callback of rigid/character bodies, and is intended for changing the direct state of that body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_total_gravity
member.summary: Return the total gravity vector being currently applied to this body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_total_linear_damp
member.summary: Return the rate at which the body stops moving, if there are not any other forces moving it.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_total_angular_damp
member.summary: Return the rate at which the body stops rotating, if there are not any other forces moving it.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_inverse_mass
member.summary: Return the inverse of the mass of the body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_inverse_inertia
member.summary: Return the inverse of the inertia of the body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.set_linear_velocity(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Change the linear velocity of the body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_linear_velocity

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.set_angular_velocity(System.Single)
member.summary: Change the angular velocity of the body.

member.summary: Set the sleeping state of the body, only affects character/rigid bodies.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.is_sleeping

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_contact_count
member.summary: Return the amount of contacts this body has with other bodies. Note that by default this returns 0 unless bodies are configured to log contacts.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_contact_local_pos(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the local position (of this body) of the contact point.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_contact_local_normal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the local normal (of this body) of the contact point.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_contact_local_shape(System.Int32)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_contact_collider_pos(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the contact position in the collider.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_contact_collider_id(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the object id of the collider.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_contact_collider_object(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the collider object, this depends on how it was created (will return a scene node if such was used to create it).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectBodyState.get_contact_collider_shape(System.Int32)

member.summary: Software implementation of [Physics2DDirectBodyState]. This object exposes no new methods or properties and should not be used, as [Physics2DDirectBodyState] selects the best implementation available.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState
member.summary: Direct access object to a space in the [Physics2DServer]. It's used mainly to do queries against objects and areas residing in a given space.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY
member.summary: Check for collisions with static bodies.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY
member.summary: Check for collisions with kinematic bodies.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_RIGID_BODY
member.summary: Check for collisions with rigid bodies.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_CHARACTER_BODY
member.summary: Check for collisions with rigid bodies in character mode.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_AREA
member.summary: Check for collisions with areas.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_COLLISION
member.summary: Check for collisions with any kind of bodies (but not areas).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.intersect_point(GodotEngine.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Object[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check whether a point is inside any shape. The shapes the point is inside of are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: shape: Shape index within the object the point is in. metadata: Metadata of the shape the point is in. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object the point is in. collider: Object the point is inside of. rid: [RID] of the object the point is in. Additionally, the method can take an array of objects or [RID]\ s that are to be excluded from collisions, a bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, and another bitmask for the types of objects to check (see TYPE_MASK_* constants). If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.intersect_ray(GodotEngine.Vector2,GodotEngine.Vector2,System.Object[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Intersect a ray in a given space. The returned object is a dictionary with the following fields: position: Place where ray is stopped. normal: Normal of the object at the point where the ray was stopped. shape: Shape index within the object against which the ray was stopped. metadata: Metadata of the shape against which the ray was stopped. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object against which the ray was stopped. collider: Object against which the ray was stopped. rid: [RID] of the object against which the ray was stopped. If the ray did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead. Additionally, the method can take an array of objects or [RID]\ s that are to be excluded from collisions, a bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, and another bitmask for the types of objects to check (see TYPE_MASK_* constants). If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.intersect_shape(GodotEngine.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The intersected shapes are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: shape: Shape index within the object the shape intersected. metadata: Metadata of the shape intersected by the shape given through the [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters]. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object the shape intersected. collider: Object the shape intersected. rid: [RID] of the object the shape intersected. The number of intersections can be limited with the second parameter, to reduce the processing time.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.cast_motion(GodotEngine.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters)
member.summary: Check whether the shape can travel to a point. If it can, the method will return an array with two floats: The first is the distance the shape can move in that direction without colliding, and the second is the distance at which it will collide. If the shape can not move, the array will be empty.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.collide_shape(GodotEngine.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The resulting array contains a list of points where the shape intersects another. Like with [method intersect_shape], the number of returned results can be limited to save processing time.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.get_rest_info(GodotEngine.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters)
member.summary: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. If it collides with more than a shape, the nearest one is selected. The returned object is a dictionary containing the following fields: pointo: Place where the shapes intersect. normal: Normal of the object at the point where the shapes intersect. shape: Shape index within the object against which the shape intersected. metadata: Metadata of the shape against which the shape intersected. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object against which the shape intersected. collider: Object against which the shape intersected. rid: [RID] of the object against which the shape intersected. linear_velocity: The movement vector of the object the shape intersected, if it was a body. If it was an area, it is (0,0). If the shape did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer
member.summary: Physics 2D Server is the server responsible for all 2D physics. It can create many kinds of physics objects, but does not insert them on the node tree.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONTACT_RECYCLE_RADIUS
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a pair of bodies has to move before their collision status has to be recalculated.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONTACT_MAX_SEPARATION
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can be from another before they are considered separated.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_MAX_ALLOWED_PENETRATION
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can penetrate another shape before it is considered a collision.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_TIME_TO_SLEEP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum time of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after this time.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONSTRAINT_DEFAULT_BIAS
member.summary: Constant to set/get the default solver bias for all physics constraints. A solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound", after violating a constraint, to avoid leaving them in that state because of numerical imprecision.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_LINE
member.summary: This is the constant for creating line shapes. A line shape is an infinite line with an origin point, and a normal. Thus, it can be used for front/behind checks.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_SEGMENT
member.summary: This is the constant for creating segment shapes. A segment shape is a line from a point A to a point B. It can be checked for intersections.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CIRCLE
member.summary: This is the constant for creating circle shapes. A circle shape only has a radius. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_RECTANGLE
member.summary: This is the constant for creating rectangle shapes. A rectangle shape is defined by a width and a height. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CAPSULE
member.summary: This is the constant for creating capsule shapes. A capsule shape is defined by a radius and a length. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CONVEX_POLYGON
member.summary: This is the constant for creating convex polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks. Unlike the method [method CollisionPolygon2D.set_polygon], polygons modified with [method shape_set_data] do not verify that the points supplied form, in fact, a convex polygon.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CONCAVE_POLYGON
member.summary: This is the constant for creating concave polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections checks, but not for inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CUSTOM
member.summary: This constant is used internally by the engine. Any attempt to create this kind of shape results in an error.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity strength in an area.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_VECTOR
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity vector/center in an area.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_IS_POINT
member.summary: Constant to set/get whether the gravity vector of an area is a direction, or a center point.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE
member.summary: Constant to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity of an area. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_POINT_ATTENUATION
member.summary: This constant was used to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity. It has been superseded by AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_LINEAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the linear dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_ANGULAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the angular dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_PRIORITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get the priority (order of processing) of an area.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED
member.summary: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Constant for static bodies.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_MODE_KINEMATIC
member.summary: Constant for kinematic bodies.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_MODE_RIGID
member.summary: Constant for rigid bodies.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_MODE_CHARACTER
member.summary: Constant for rigid bodies in character mode. In this mode, a body can not rotate, and only its linear velocity is affected by physics.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_PARAM_BOUNCE
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's bounce factor.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_PARAM_FRICTION
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's friction.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_PARAM_MASS
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's mass.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_PARAM_INERTIA
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's inertia.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_PARAM_GRAVITY_SCALE
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's gravity multiplier.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_PARAM_LINEAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's linear dampening factor.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_PARAM_ANGULAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's angular dampening factor.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_PARAM_MAX
member.summary: This is the last ID for body parameters. Any attempt to set this property is ignored. Any attempt to get it returns 0.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_STATE_TRANSFORM
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current transform matrix of the body.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_STATE_LINEAR_VELOCITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current linear velocity of the body.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_STATE_ANGULAR_VELOCITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current angular velocity of the body.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_STATE_SLEEPING
member.summary: Constant to sleep/wake up a body, or to get whether it is sleeping.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.BODY_STATE_CAN_SLEEP
member.summary: Constant to set/get whether the body can sleep.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.JOINT_PIN
member.summary: Constant to create pin joints.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.JOINT_GROOVE
member.summary: Constant to create groove joints.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.JOINT_DAMPED_SPRING
member.summary: Constant to create damped spring joints.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.DAMPED_STRING_REST_LENGTH
member.summary: Set the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.DAMPED_STRING_STIFFNESS
member.summary: Set the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.DAMPED_STRING_DAMPING
member.summary: Set the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.CCD_MODE_DISABLED
member.summary: Disables continuous collision detection. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.CCD_MODE_CAST_RAY
member.summary: Enables continuous collision detection by raycasting. It is faster than shapecasting, but less precise.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.CCD_MODE_CAST_SHAPE
member.summary: Enables continuous collision detection by shapecasting. It is the slowest CCD method, and the most precise.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_BODY_ADDED
member.summary: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object enters one of its shapes.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.AREA_BODY_REMOVED
member.summary: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object exits one of its shapes.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.INFO_ACTIVE_OBJECTS
member.summary: Constant to get the number of objects that are not sleeping.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.INFO_COLLISION_PAIRS
member.summary: Constant to get the number of possible collisions.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.INFO_ISLAND_COUNT
member.summary: Constant to get the number of space regions where a collision could occur.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.shape_create(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a shape of type SHAPE_*. Does not assign it to a body or an area. To do so, you must use [method area_set_shape] or [method body_set_shape].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.shape_set_data(GodotEngine.RID,System.Object)
member.summary: Set the shape data that defines its shape and size. The data to be passed depends on the kind of shape created [method shape_get_type].

member.summary: Return the type of shape (see SHAPE_* constants).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.shape_get_data(GodotEngine.RID)
member.summary: Return the shape data.

member.summary: Create a space. A space is a collection of parameters for the physics engine that can be assigned to an area or a body. It can be assigned to an area with [method area_set_space], or to a body with [method body_set_space].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.space_set_active(GodotEngine.RID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Mark a space as active. It will not have an effect, unless it is assigned to an area or body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.space_is_active(GodotEngine.RID)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.space_get_param(GodotEngine.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the value of a space parameter.

member.summary: Return the state of a space, a [Physics2DDirectSpaceState]. This object can be used to make collision/intersection queries.

member.summary: Return the space override mode for the area.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.area_set_monitor_callback(GodotEngine.RID,GodotEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Set the function to call when any body/area enters or exits the area. This callback will be called for any object interacting with the area, and takes five parameters: 1: AREA_BODY_ADDED or AREA_BODY_REMOVED, depending on whether the object entered or exited the area. 2: [RID] of the object that entered/exited the area. 3: Instance ID of the object that entered/exited the area. 4: The shape index of the object that entered/exited the area. 5: The shape index of the area where the object entered/exited.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.body_apply_impulse(GodotEngine.RID,GodotEngine.Vector2,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Add a positioned impulse to the applied force and torque. Both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.body_add_force(GodotEngine.RID,GodotEngine.Vector2,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Add a positioned force to the applied force and torque. As with [method body_apply_impulse], both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates. A force differs from an impulse in that, while the two are forces, the impulse clears itself after being applied.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.body_set_axis_velocity(GodotEngine.RID,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.summary: Add a body to the list of bodies exempt from collisions.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.body_remove_collision_exception(GodotEngine.RID,GodotEngine.RID)
member.summary: Remove a body from the list of bodies exempt from collisions.

member.summary: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.body_get_max_contacts_reported(GodotEngine.RID)
member.summary: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method body_set_max_contacts_reported].

member.summary: Set whether a body uses a callback function to calculate its own physics (see [method body_set_force_integration_callback]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Physics2DServer.body_is_omitting_force_integration(GodotEngine.RID)
member.summary: Return whether a body uses a callback function to calculate its own physics (see [method body_set_force_integration_callback]).

member.summary: Set the function used to calculate physics for an object, if that object allows it (see [method body_set_omit_force integration]).

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody
member.summary: PhysicsBody is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All PhysicsBody types inherit from it.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D
member.summary: PhysicsBody2D is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All *Body2D types inherit from it.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D.set_collision_layer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers are not visual, but more of a tagging system instead. A collidable can use these layers/tags to select with which objects it can collide, using [method set_collision_mask]. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D.get_collision_layer
member.summary: Return the physics layer this area is in.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D.set_collision_mask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D.get_collision_mask
member.summary: Return the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D.set_collision_mask_bit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D.get_collision_mask_bit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D.set_collision_layer_bit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This makes getting a body in/out of only one layer easier.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PhysicsBody2D.get_collision_layer_bit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED
member.summary: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PinJoint2D
member.summary: Pin Joint for 2D Rigid Bodies. It pins 2 bodies (rigid or static) together, or a single body to a fixed position in space.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Polygon2D
member.summary: A Polygon2D is defined by a set of n vertices connected together by line segments, meaning that the vertex 1 will be connected with vertex 2, vertex 2 with vertex 3 ..., vertex n-1 with vertex n and vertex n with vertex 1 in order to close the loop and define a polygon.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_polygon(GodotEngine.Vector2[])
member.summary: Define the set of vertices that will represent the polygon.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_polygon
member.summary: Return the set of vertices that defines this polygon.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_uv(GodotEngine.Vector2[])
member.summary: Set the texture coordinates for every vertex of the polygon. There should be one uv vertex for every vertex in the polygon. If there are less, the undefined ones will be assumed to be (0,0). Extra uv vertices are ignored.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_uv
member.summary: Return the texture coordinates associated with every vertex of the polygon.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_color(GodotEngine.Color)
member.summary: Set the polygon fill color. If the polygon has a texture defined, the defined texture will be multiplied by the polygon fill color. This, also, is the default color for those vertices that are not defined by [method get_vertex_colors].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_color
member.summary: Return the polygon fill color.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_vertex_colors(GodotEngine.Color[])
member.summary: Set the color for each vertex of the polygon. There should be one color for every vertex in the polygon. If there are less, the undefined ones will be assumed to be [method get_color]. Extra color entries are ignored. Colors are interpolated between vertices, resulting in smooth gradients when they differ.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_vertex_colors
member.summary: Return the list of vertex colors.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_texture
member.summary: Return the polygon texture

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_texture_offset(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the offset of the polygon texture. Initially the texture will appear anchored to the polygon position, the offset is used to move the texture location away from that point (notice that the texture origin is set to its top left corner, so when offset is 0,0 the top left corner of the texture is at the polygon position), for example setting the offset to 10, 10 will move the texture 10 units to the left and 10 units to the top.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_texture_offset
member.summary: Return the polygon texture offset.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_texture_rotation(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the amount of rotation of the polygon texture, [code]texture_rotation[/code] is specified in radians and clockwise rotation.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_texture_rotation
member.summary: Return the rotation in radians of the texture polygon.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_texture_scale(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the value that will multiply the uv coordinates ([method get_uv]) when applying the texture. Larger values make the texture smaller, and vice versa.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_texture_scale
member.summary: Return the uv coordinate multiplier.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_invert(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the polygon as the defined polygon bounding box minus the defined polygon (the defined polygon will appear as a hole on the square that contains the defined polygon).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_invert
member.summary: Return whether this polygon is inverted or not.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_invert_border(System.Single)
member.summary: Add extra padding around the bounding box, making it bigger. Too small a value can make the polygon triangulate strangely, due to numerical imprecision.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_invert_border
member.summary: Return the added padding around the bounding box.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.set_offset(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the an offset that will be added to the vertices' position. E.g. if the offset is set to (10,10) then all the polygon points will move 10 units to the right and 10 units to the bottom.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Polygon2D.get_offset
member.summary: Return the offset for the polygon vertices.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Popup

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Popup.NOTIFICATION_POPUP_HIDE

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Popup.popup_centered(System.Nullable{GodotEngine.Vector2})

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Popup.popup_centered_ratio(System.Single)
member.summary: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, scaled at a ratio of size of the screen.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Popup.popup_centered_minsize(System.Nullable{GodotEngine.Vector2})
member.summary: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, ensuring the size is never smaller than [code]minsize[/code]. If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Popup.popup(System.Nullable{GodotEngine.Rect2})
member.summary: Popup (show the control in modal form). If the param is null, then the default value is new Rect2(0, 0, 0, 0)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Popup.set_exclusive(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make the popup hide other popups when shown on the screen.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Popup.is_exclusive
member.summary: Returns whether the popup will hide other popups when shown on the screen.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PopupDialog

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PopupMenu
member.summary: PopupMenu is the typical Control that displays a list of options. They are popular in toolbars or context menus.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PopupMenu.add_item(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a new item with text "label". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator keybinding. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PopupMenu.add_submenu_item(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an item with a submenu. The submenu is the name of a child PopupMenu node that would be shown when the item is clicked. An id can optionally be provided, but if is isn't provided, one will be created from the index.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.PopupMenu.set_item_checked(System.Int32,System.Boolean)

member.name: T:GodotEngine.PopupPanel
member.summary: Class for displaying popups with a panel background. In some cases it might be simpler to use than [Popup], since it provides a configurable background. If you are making windows, better check [WindowDialog].

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Portal
member.summary: Portals provide virtual openings to [VisualInstance] nodes, so cameras can look at them from the outside. Note that portals are a visibility optimization technique, and are in no way related to the game of the same name (as in, they are not used for teleportation). For more information on how rooms and portals work, see [VisualInstance]. Portals are represented as 2D convex polygon shapes (in the X,Y local plane), and are placed on the surface of the areas occupied by a [VisualInstance], to indicate that the room can be accessed or looked-at through them. If two rooms are next to each other, and two similar portals in each of them share the same world position (and are parallel and opposed to each other), they will automatically "connect" and form "doors" (for example, the portals that connect a kitchen to a living room are placed in the door they share). Portals must always have a [VisualInstance] node as a parent, grandparent or far parent, or else they will not be active.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.set_shape(GodotEngine.Vector2[])
member.summary: Set the portal shape. The shape is an array of [Vector2] points, representing a convex polygon in the X,Y plane.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.get_shape
member.summary: Return the portal shape. The shape is an array of [Vector2] points, representing a convex polygon in the X,Y plane.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.set_enabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable the portal (it is enabled by default though), disabling it will cause the parent [VisualInstance] to not be visible any longer when looking through the portal.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.is_enabled
member.summary: Return whether the portal is active. When disabled it causes the parent [VisualInstance] to not be visible any longer when looking through the portal.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.set_disable_distance(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the distance threshold for disabling the portal. Every time that the portal goes beyond "distance", it disables itself, becoming the opaque color (see [method set_disabled_color]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.get_disable_distance
member.summary: Return the distance threshold for disabling the portal. Every time that the portal goes beyond "distance", it disables itself, becoming the opaque color (see [method set_disabled_color]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.set_disabled_color(GodotEngine.Color)
member.summary: When the portal goes beyond the disable distance (see [method set_disable_distance]), it becomes opaque and displayed with color "color".

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.get_disabled_color
member.summary: Return the color for when the portal goes beyond the disable distance (see [method set_disable_distance]) and becomes disabled.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.set_connect_range(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the range for auto-connecting two portals from different rooms sharing the same space.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Portal.get_connect_range
member.summary: Return the range for auto-connecting two portals from different rooms sharing the same space.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ProgressBar
member.summary: General purpose progress bar. Shows fill percentage from right to left.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ProjectSettings
member.summary: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere. Use the normal [Object] API, such as "ProjectSettings.get(variable)", "ProjectSettings.set(variable,value)" or "ProjectSettings.has(variable)" to access them. Variables stored in project.godot are also loaded into ProjectSettings, making this object very useful for reading custom game configuration options.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ProjectSettings.has(System.String)
member.summary: Return true if a configuration value is present.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ProjectSettings.set_order(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the order of a configuration value (influences when saved to the config file).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ProjectSettings.get_order(System.String)
member.summary: Return the order of a configuration value (influences when saved to the config file).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ProjectSettings.add_property_info(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Add a custom property info to a property. The dictionary must contain: name:[String](the name of the property) and type:[int](see TYPE_* in [@Global Scope]), and optionally hint:[int](see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@Global Scope]), hint_string:[String]. Example: [codeblock] ProjectSettings.set("category/property_name", 0) var property_info = { "name": "category/property_name", "type": TYPE_INT, "hint": PROPERTY_HINT_ENUM, "hint_string": "one,two,three" } ProjectSettings.add_property_info(property_info) [/codeblock]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ProjectSettings.clear(System.String)
member.summary: Clear the whole configuration (not recommended, may break things).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ProjectSettings.localize_path(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a path to a localized path (res:// path).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ProjectSettings.globalize_path(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a localized path (res://) to a full native OS path.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Range

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Range.get_max

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Range.get_step

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Range.get_page

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Range.get_as_ratio

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Range.set_min(System.Single)
