member.name: T:GodotEngine.RayCast
member.summary: A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position [code]cast_to[/code], it is used to query the 3D space in order to find the closest object intersecting with the ray. RayCast can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], setting proper filtering with layers, or by filtering object types with type masks. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions! RayCast calculates intersection every fixed frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between fixed frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.set_enabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables the RayCast2D. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.is_enabled
member.summary: Returns whether this raycast is enabled or not.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.set_cast_to(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets to which point ray should be casted. This point is in [b]local[/b] coordinate system.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.get_cast_to
member.summary: Return the destination point of this ray object.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.is_colliding
member.summary: Return whether the closest object the ray is pointing to is colliding with the vector (considering the vector length).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.force_raycast_update
member.summary: Updates the collision information in case if this object's properties changed during the current frame (for example position, rotation or the cast_point). Note, [code]set_enabled[/code] is not required for this to work.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.get_collider
member.summary: Return the closest object the ray is pointing to. Note that this does not consider the length of the vector, so you must also use [method is_colliding] to check if the object returned is actually colliding with the ray.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.get_collider_shape
member.summary: Returns the collision shape of the closest object the ray is pointing to.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.get_collision_point
member.summary: Returns collision point. This point is in [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.get_collision_normal
member.summary: Returns the normal of the intersecting object shape face containing the collision point.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.add_exception(GodotEngine.Object)
member.summary: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.remove_exception(GodotEngine.Object)
member.summary: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.clear_exceptions
member.summary: Removes all collision exception for this ray.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.set_collision_layer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the mask to filter objects. Only objects with at least the same mask element set will be detected.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.get_collision_layer
member.summary: Returns the collision layer for this ray.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.set_type_mask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the types of objects to detect. For [code]mask[/code] use a logic sum (OR operation) of constants defined in [PhysicsDirectSpaceState], eg. [code]PhysicsDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | PhysicsDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY[/code] to detect only those two types.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast.get_type_mask
member.summary: Returns the type mask (types of objects to detect) for this ray. The value is a sum (bitwise OR'd) of constants available for [PhysicsDirectSpaceState].

member.name: T:GodotEngine.RayCast2D
member.summary: A RayCast2D represents a line from its origin to its destination position [code]cast_to[/code], it is used to query the 2D space in order to find the closest object intersecting with the ray. RayCast2D can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], setting proper filtering with layers, or by filtering object types with type masks. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions! RayCast2D calculates intersection every fixed frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between fixed frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.set_enabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables the RayCast2D. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.is_enabled
member.summary: Returns whether this raycast is enabled or not.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.set_cast_to(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the ray destination point, so that the ray will test from the ray's origin to [code]local_point[/code]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.get_cast_to
member.summary: Return the destination point of this ray object.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.is_colliding
member.summary: Return whether the closest object the ray is pointing to is colliding with the vector (considering the vector length).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.force_raycast_update
member.summary: Updates the collision information in case if this object's properties changed during the current frame (for example position, rotation or the cast_point). Note, [code]set_enabled[/code] is not required for this to work.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.get_collider
member.summary: Return the closest object the ray is pointing to. Note that this does not consider the length of the vector, so you must also use [method is_colliding] to check if the object returned is actually colliding with the ray.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.get_collider_shape
member.summary: Returns the collision shape of the closest object the ray is pointing to.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.get_collision_point
member.summary: Returns the collision point in which the ray intersects the closest object. This point is in [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.get_collision_normal
member.summary: Returns the normal of the intersecting object shape face containing the collision point.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.add_exception(GodotEngine.Object)
member.summary: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.remove_exception(GodotEngine.Object)
member.summary: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.clear_exceptions
member.summary: Removes all collision exception for this ray.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.set_collision_layer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the mask to filter objects. Only objects with at least the same mask element set will be detected.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.get_collision_layer
member.summary: Returns the collision layer for this ray.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.set_type_mask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the types of objects to detect. For [code]mask[/code] use a logic sum (OR operation) of constants defined in [Physics2DDirectSpaceState], eg. [code]Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY[/code] to detect only those two types.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.get_type_mask
member.summary: Returns the type mask (types of objects to detect) for this ray. The value is a sum (bitwise OR'd) of constants available for [Physics2DDirectSpaceState].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.set_exclude_parent_body(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Toggle whether this ray should hit your parent node, if it's a body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayCast2D.get_exclude_parent_body
member.summary: Returns whether this ray should hit your parent node, if it's a body.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.RayShape2D
member.summary: Ray 2D shape resource for physics. A ray is not really a collision body, instead it tries to separate itself from whatever is touching its far endpoint. It's often useful for characters.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayShape2D.set_length(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the length of the ray.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RayShape2D.get_length
member.summary: Return the length of the ray.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.RectangleShape2D
member.summary: Rectangle Shape for 2D Physics. This shape is useful for modeling box-like 2D objects.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RectangleShape2D.set_extents(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the half extents, the actual width and height of this shape is twice the half extents.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RectangleShape2D.get_extents
member.summary: Return the half extents, the actual width and height of this shape is twice the half extents.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Reference
member.summary: Base class for anything that keeps a reference count. Resource and many other helper objects inherit this. References keep an internal reference counter so they are only released when no longer in use.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Reference.reference
member.summary: Increase the internal reference counter. Use this only if you really know what you are doing.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Reference.unreference
member.summary: Decrease the internal reference counter. Use this only if you really know what you are doing.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ReferenceRect
member.summary: Reference frame for GUI. It's just like an empty control, except a red box is displayed while editing around its size at all times.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegEx.clear
member.summary: This method resets the state of the object, as it was freshly created. Namely, it unassigns the regular expression of this object.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegEx.compile(System.String)
member.summary: Compiles and assign the regular expression pattern to use.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegEx.search(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the text for the compiled pattern. Returns a [RegExMatch] container of the first matching reult if found, otherwise null. The region to search within can be specified without modifying where the start and end anchor would be.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegEx.is_valid
member.summary: Returns whether this object has a valid regular expression assigned.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegEx.get_pattern
member.summary: Returns the expression used to compile the code.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegEx.get_group_count
member.summary: Returns the number of numeric capturing groups.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegEx.get_names
member.summary: Returns an array of names of named capturing groups.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegExMatch.get_group_count
member.summary: Returns the number of numeric capturing groups.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegExMatch.get_group_array
member.summary: Returns an array of the results of the numeric groups.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegExMatch.get_names
member.summary: Returns an array of names of named capturing groups.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegExMatch.get_name_dict
member.summary: Returns a dictionary containing the named capturing groups and their results.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegExMatch.get_string(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the result of the match in the string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern). If the param is null, then the default value is 0

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegExMatch.get_start(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the starting position of the match in the string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern). If the param is null, then the default value is 0

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RegExMatch.get_end(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the end position of the match in the string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern). If the param is null, then the default value is 0

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Resource
member.summary: Resource is the base class for all resource types. Resources are primarily data containers. They are reference counted and freed when no longer in use. They are also loaded only once from disk, and further attempts to load the resource will return the same reference (all this in contrast to a [Node], which is not reference counted and can be instanced from disk as many times as desired). Resources can be saved externally on disk or bundled into another object, such as a [Node] or another resource.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Resource.set_path(System.String)
member.summary: Set the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else. Fails if another [Resource] already has path "path".

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Resource.take_over_path(System.String)
member.summary: Set the path of the resource. Differs from set_path(), if another [Resource] exists with "path" it over-takes it, instead of failing.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Resource.get_path
member.summary: Return the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Resource.set_name(System.String)
member.summary: Set the name of the resources, any name is valid (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Resource.get_name
member.summary: Return the name of the resources, any name is valid (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Resource.get_rid
member.summary: Return the RID of the resource (or an empty RID). Many resources (such as [Texture], [Mesh], etc) are high level abstractions of resources stored in a server, so this function will return the original RID.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ResourceInteractiveLoader
member.summary: Interactive Resource Loader. This object is returned by ResourceLoader when performing an interactive load. It allows to load with high granularity, so this is mainly useful for displaying load bars/percentages.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourceInteractiveLoader.get_resource
member.summary: Return the loaded resource (only if loaded). Otherwise, returns null.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourceInteractiveLoader.poll
member.summary: Poll the load. If OK is returned, this means poll will have to be called again. If ERR_FILE_EOF is returned, them the load has finished and the resource can be obtained by calling [method get_resource].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourceInteractiveLoader.get_stage
member.summary: Return the load stage. The total amount of stages can be queried with [method get_stage_count]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourceInteractiveLoader.get_stage_count
member.summary: Return the total amount of stages (calls to [method poll]) needed to completely load this resource.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ResourcePreloader
member.summary: Resource Preloader Node. This node is used to preload sub-resources inside a scene, so when the scene is loaded all the resources are ready to use and be retrieved from here.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourcePreloader.remove_resource(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a resource from the preloader by text id.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourcePreloader.rename_resource(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rename a resource inside the preloader, from a text-id to a new text-id.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourcePreloader.has_resource(System.String)
member.summary: Return true if the preloader has a given resource.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourcePreloader.get_resource(System.String)
member.summary: Return the resource given a text-id.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourcePreloader.get_resource_list
member.summary: Return the list of resources inside the preloader.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.RichTextLabel
member.summary: Label that displays rich text. Rich text can contain custom text, fonts, images and some basic formatting. It also adapts itself to given width/heights.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RichTextLabel.get_text
member.summary: Returns the raw text, stripping out the formatting information.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RichTextLabel.set_selection_enabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set to true if selecting the text inside this richtext is allowed.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RichTextLabel.is_selection_enabled
member.summary: Return true if selecting the text inside this richtext is allowed.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.RigidBody
member.summary: Rigid body node. This node is used for placing rigid bodies in the scene. It can contain a number of shapes, and also shift mode between regular Rigid body, Kinematic, Character or Static.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody.MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Static mode. The body behaves like a [StaticBody], and can only move by user code.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody.MODE_KINEMATIC
member.summary: Kinematic body. The body behaves like a [KinematicBody], and can only move by user code.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody.MODE_RIGID
member.summary: Rigid body. This is the "natural" state of a rigid body. It is affected by forces, and can move, rotate, and be affected by user code.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody.MODE_CHARACTER
member.summary: Character body. This behaves like a rigid body, but can not rotate.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_mode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the body mode, from the MODE_* enum. This allows to change to a static body or a character body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_mode
member.summary: Return the current body mode, see [method set_mode].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_mass(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body mass.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_mass
member.summary: Return the current body mass.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_weight(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_weight
member.summary: Return the current body weight, given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_friction(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (max friction).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_friction
member.summary: Return the current body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (max friction).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_bounce(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (no bounciness) to 1 (max bounciness).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_bounce
member.summary: Return the current body bounciness.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_linear_velocity(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Set the body linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_linear_velocity
member.summary: Return the current body linear velocity.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_angular_velocity(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Set the body angular velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_angular_velocity
member.summary: Return the current body angular velocity.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_gravity_scale(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the gravity factor. This factor multiplies gravity intensity just for this body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_gravity_scale
member.summary: Return the current body gravity scale.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_linear_damp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the linear damp for this body. Default of -1, cannot be less than -1. If this value is different from -1, any linear damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_linear_damp
member.summary: Return the current body linear damp. Default is -1.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_angular_damp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the angular damp for this body. Default of -1, cannot be less than -1. If this value is different from -1, any angular damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_angular_damp
member.summary: Return the current body angular damp. Default is -1.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_max_contacts_reported(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_max_contacts_reported
member.summary: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method set_max_contacts_reported].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_use_custom_integrator(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pass true to disable the internal force integration (like gravity or air friction) for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function, if defined.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.is_using_custom_integrator
member.summary: Return whether the body is using a custom integrator.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_contact_monitor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable contact monitoring. This allows the body to emit signals when it collides with another.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.is_contact_monitor_enabled
member.summary: Return whether contact monitoring is enabled.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_use_continuous_collision_detection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the continuous collision detection mode from the enum CCD_MODE_*. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided. The first is more precise, and misses less impacts by small, fast-moving objects. The second is faster to compute, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.is_using_continuous_collision_detection
member.summary: Return whether this body is using continuous collision detection.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_axis_velocity(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Set an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.apply_impulse(GodotEngine.Vector3,GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Apply a positioned impulse (which will be affected by the body mass and shape). This is the equivalent of hitting a billiard ball with a cue: a force that is applied once, and only once. Both the impulse and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_sleeping(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether a body is sleeping or not. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.is_sleeping
member.summary: Return whether the body is sleeping.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_can_sleep(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the body ability to fall asleep when not moving. This saves an enormous amount of processor time when there are plenty of rigid bodies (non static) in a scene. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.is_able_to_sleep
member.summary: Return whether the body has the ability to fall asleep when not moving. See [method set_can_sleep].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.set_axis_lock(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the axis lock of the body, from the AXIS_LOCK_* enum. Axis lock stops the body from moving along the specified axis(X/Y/Z) and rotating along the other two axes.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_axis_lock
member.summary: Return the current axis lock of the body. One of AXIS_LOCK_* enum.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody.get_colliding_bodies
member.summary: Return a list of the bodies colliding with this one. By default, number of max contacts reported is at 0 , see [method set_max_contacts_reported] to increase it.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D
member.summary: Rigid body 2D node. This node is used for placing rigid bodies in the scene. It can contain a number of shapes, and also shift state between regular Rigid body, Kinematic, Character or Static. Character mode forbids the node from being rotated. This node can have a custom force integrator function, for writing complex physics motion behavior per node. As a warning, don't change this node position every frame or very often. Sporadic changes work fine, but physics runs at a different granularity (fixed hz) than usual rendering (process callback) and maybe even in a separate thread, so changing this from a process loop will yield strange behavior.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Static mode. The body behaves like a [StaticBody2D], and can only move by user code.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.MODE_KINEMATIC
member.summary: Kinematic body. The body behaves like a [KinematicBody2D], and can only move by user code.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.MODE_RIGID
member.summary: Rigid body. This is the "natural" state of a rigid body. It is affected by forces, and can move, rotate, and be affected by user code.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.MODE_CHARACTER
member.summary: Character body. This behaves like a rigid body, but can not rotate.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.CCD_MODE_DISABLED
member.summary: Disables continuous collision detection. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.CCD_MODE_CAST_RAY
member.summary: Enables continuous collision detection by raycasting. It is faster than shapecasting, but less precise.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.CCD_MODE_CAST_SHAPE
member.summary: Enables continuous collision detection by shapecasting. It is the slowest CCD method, and the most precise.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_mode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the body mode, from the MODE_* enum. This allows to change to a static body or a character body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_mode
member.summary: Return the current body mode, see [method set_mode].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_mass(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body mass.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_mass
member.summary: Return the body mass.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_inertia
member.summary: Return the body's moment of inertia. This is usually automatically computed from the mass and the shapes. Note that this doesn't seem to work in a [code]_ready[/code] function: it apparently has not been auto-computed yet.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_inertia(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body's moment of inertia. This is like mass, but for rotation: it determines how much torque it takes to rotate the body. The moment of inertia is usually computed automatically from the mass and the shapes, but this function allows you to set a custom value. Set 0 (or negative) inertia to return to automatically computing it.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_weight(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8). Not really useful for 2D since most measures for this node are in pixels.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_weight
member.summary: Return the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_friction(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_friction
member.summary: Return the body friction.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_bounce(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (no bounce) to 1 (full bounce).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_bounce
member.summary: Return the body bounciness.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_gravity_scale(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the gravity factor. This factor multiplies gravity intensity just for this body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_gravity_scale
member.summary: Return the gravity factor.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_linear_damp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the linear damp for this body. If this value is different from -1, any linear damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_linear_damp
member.summary: Return the linear damp for this body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_angular_damp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the angular damp for this body. If this value is different from -1, any angular damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_angular_damp
member.summary: Return the angular damp for this body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_linear_velocity(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the body linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_linear_velocity
member.summary: Return the body linear velocity. This changes by physics granularity. See [method set_linear_velocity].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_angular_velocity(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body angular velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_angular_velocity
member.summary: Return the body angular velocity. This changes by physics granularity. See [method set_angular_velocity].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_max_contacts_reported(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_max_contacts_reported
member.summary: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method set_max_contacts_reported].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_use_custom_integrator(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pass true to disable the internal force integration (like gravity or air friction) for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function, if defined.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.is_using_custom_integrator
member.summary: Return true if the body is not doing any built-in force integration.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_contact_monitor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable contact monitoring. This allows the body to emit signals when it collides with another.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.is_contact_monitor_enabled
member.summary: Return whether contact monitoring is enabled.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_continuous_collision_detection_mode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the continuous collision detection mode from the enum CCD_MODE_*. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided. The first is more precise, and misses less impacts by small, fast-moving objects. The second is faster to compute, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_continuous_collision_detection_mode
member.summary: Return whether this body is using continuous collision detection.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_axis_velocity(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.apply_impulse(GodotEngine.Vector2,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Apply a positioned impulse (which will be affected by the body mass and shape). This is the equivalent of hitting a billiard ball with a cue: a force that is applied once, and only once. Both the impulse and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_applied_force(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the applied force vector. This is the equivalent of pushing a box over the ground: the force applied is applied constantly.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_applied_force
member.summary: Return the applied force vector.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_applied_torque(System.Single)
member.summary: Set a constant torque which will be applied to this body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_applied_torque
member.summary: Return the torque which is being applied to this body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.add_force(GodotEngine.Vector2,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Add a positioned force to the applied force and torque. As with [method apply_impulse], both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_sleeping(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether a body is sleeping or not. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.is_sleeping
member.summary: Return whether the body is sleeping.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.set_can_sleep(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the body ability to fall asleep when not moving. This saves an enormous amount of processor time when there are plenty of rigid bodies (non static) in a scene. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.is_able_to_sleep
member.summary: Return true if the body has the ability to fall asleep when not moving. See [method set_can_sleep].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.test_motion(GodotEngine.Vector2,System.Single,GodotEngine.Physics2DTestMotionResult)
member.summary: Return whether the body would collide, if it tried to move in the given vector. This method allows two extra parameters: A margin, which increases slightly the size of the shapes involved in the collision detection, and an object of type [Physics2DTestMotionResult], which will store additional information about the collision (should there be one).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.RigidBody2D.get_colliding_bodies
member.summary: Return a list of the bodies colliding with this one. By default, number of max contacts reported is at 0 , see [method set_max_contacts_reported] to increase it. You must also enable contact monitor, see [method set_contact_monitor]

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Room
member.summary: Room contains the data to define the bounds of a scene (using a BSP Tree). It is instanced by a [VisualInstance] node to create rooms. See that class documentation for more information about rooms.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SceneTree.set_network_peer(GodotEngine.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer)
member.summary: Set the peer object to handle the RPC system (effectively enabling networking). Depending on the peer itself, the SceneTree will become a network server (check with [method is_network_server()]) and will set root node's network mode to master (see NETWORK_MODE_* constants in [Node]), or it will become a regular peer with root node set to slave. All child nodes are set to inherit the network mode by default. Handling of networking-related events (connection, disconnection, new clients) is done by connecting to SceneTree's signals.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SceneTree.is_network_server
member.summary: Returns true if this SceneTree's [NetworkedMultiplayerPeer] is in server mode (listening for connections).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SceneTree.has_network_peer
member.summary: Returns true if there is a [NetworkedMultiplayerPeer] set (with [method SceneTree.set_network_peer]).

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Script
member.summary: Base class for scripts. Any script that is loaded becomes one of these resources, which can then create instances.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Script.can_instance

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Script.instance_has(GodotEngine.Object)

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ScrollBar
member.summary: Scrollbars are a [Range] based [Control], that display a draggable area (the size of the page). Horizontal ([HScrollBar]) and Vertical ([VScrollBar]) versions are available.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer
member.summary: A ScrollContainer node with a [Control] child and scrollbar child ([HScrollbar], [VScrollBar], or both) will only draw the Control within the ScrollContainer area. Scrollbars will automatically be drawn at the right (for vertical) or bottom (for horizontal) and will enable dragging to move the viewable Control (and its children) within the ScrollContainer. Scrollbars will also automatically resize the grabber based on the minimum_size of the Control relative to the ScrollContainer. Works great with a [Panel] control. You can set EXPAND on children size flags, so they will upscale to ScrollContainer size if ScrollContainer size is bigger (scroll is invisible for chosen dimension).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer.set_enable_h_scroll(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set allows horizontal scroll.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer.is_h_scroll_enabled
member.summary: Return true if horizontal scroll is allowed.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer.set_enable_v_scroll(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set allows vertical scroll.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer.is_v_scroll_enabled
member.summary: Return true if vertical scroll is allowed.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer.set_h_scroll(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set horizontal scroll value.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer.get_h_scroll
member.summary: Return current horizontal scroll value.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer.set_v_scroll(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set vertical scroll value.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ScrollContainer.get_v_scroll
member.summary: Return current vertical scroll value.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Shader
member.summary: To be changed, ignore.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Shape2D
member.summary: Base class for all 2D Shapes. All 2D shape types inherit from this.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Shape2D.set_custom_solver_bias(System.Single)
member.summary: Use a custom solver bias. No need to change this unless you really know what you are doing. The solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound" off each other, when colliding, to avoid them getting into each other because of numerical imprecision.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Shape2D.get_custom_solver_bias
member.summary: Return the custom solver bias.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Shape2D.collide(GodotEngine.Transform2D,GodotEngine.Shape2D,GodotEngine.Transform2D)
member.summary: Return whether this shape is colliding with another. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), and the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Shape2D.collide_with_motion(GodotEngine.Transform2D,GodotEngine.Vector2,GodotEngine.Shape2D,GodotEngine.Transform2D,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Return whether this shape would collide with another, if a given movement was applied. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the movement to test on this shape ([code]local_motion[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]), and the movement to test onto the other object ([code]shape_motion[/code]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Shape2D.collide_and_get_contacts(GodotEngine.Transform2D,GodotEngine.Shape2D,GodotEngine.Transform2D)
member.summary: Return a list of the points where this shape touches another. If there are no collisions, the list is empty. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), and the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Shape2D.collide_with_motion_and_get_contacts(GodotEngine.Transform2D,GodotEngine.Vector2,GodotEngine.Shape2D,GodotEngine.Transform2D,GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Return a list of the points where this shape would touch another, if a given movement was applied. If there are no collisions, the list is empty. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the movement to test on this shape ([code]local_motion[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]), and the movement to test onto the other object ([code]shape_motion[/code]).

member.summary: Skeleton provides a hierarchical interface for managing bones, including pose, rest and animation (see [Animation]). Skeleton will support rag doll dynamics in the future.

member.summary: Return the bone index which is the parent of the bone at "bone_idx". If -1, then bone has no parent. Note that the parent bone returned will always be less than "bone_idx".

member.name: T:GodotEngine.StaticBody
member.summary: Static body for 3D Physics. A static body is a simple body that is not intended to move. They don't consume any CPU resources in contrast to a [RigidBody3D] so they are great for scenario collision. A static body can also be animated by using simulated motion mode. This is useful for implementing functionalities such as moving platforms. When this mode is active the body can be animated and automatically computes linear and angular velocity to apply in that frame and to influence other bodies. Alternatively, a constant linear or angular velocity can be set for the static body, so even if it doesn't move, it affects other bodies as if it was moving (this is useful for simulating conveyor belts or conveyor wheels).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StaticBody.set_constant_linear_velocity(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Set a constant linear velocity for the body. This does not move the body, but affects other bodies touching it, as if it was moving.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StaticBody.set_constant_angular_velocity(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Set a constant angular velocity for the body. This does not rotate the body, but affects other bodies touching it, as if it was rotating.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StaticBody.get_constant_linear_velocity
member.summary: Return the constant linear velocity for the body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StaticBody.get_constant_angular_velocity
member.summary: Return the constant angular velocity for the body.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StaticBody.set_friction(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StaticBody.get_friction
member.summary: Return the body friction.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StaticBody.set_bounce(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (not bouncy) to 1 (bouncy).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StaticBody.get_bounce
member.summary: Return the body bounciness.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.StreamPeer
member.summary: StreamPeer is an abstraction and base class for stream-based protocols (such as TCP or Unix Sockets). It provides an API for sending and receiving data through streams as raw data or strings.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StreamPeer.put_data(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a chunk of data through the connection, blocking if necessary until the data is done sending. This function returns an Error code.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StreamPeer.put_partial_data(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a chunk of data through the connection, if all the data could not be sent at once, only part of it will. This function returns two values, an Error code and an integer, describing how much data was actually sent.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StreamPeer.get_data(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a chunk data with the received bytes. The amount of bytes to be received can be requested in the "bytes" argument. If not enough bytes are available, the function will block until the desired amount is received. This function returns two values, an Error code and a data array.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StreamPeer.get_partial_data(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a chunk data with the received bytes. The amount of bytes to be received can be requested in the "bytes" argument. If not enough bytes are available, the function will return how many were actually received. This function returns two values, an Error code, and a data array.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StreamPeer.get_available_bytes
member.summary: Return the amount of bytes this [StreamPeer] has available.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StreamPeer.set_big_endian(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set this [StreamPeer] to use big-endian format. Default is false.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StreamPeer.is_big_endian_enabled
member.summary: Return whether this [StreamPeer] is using big-endian format.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.StyleBox
member.summary: StyleBox is [Resource] that provides an abstract base class for drawing stylized boxes for the UI. StyleBoxes are used for drawing the styles of buttons, line edit backgrounds, tree backgrounds, etc. and also for testing a transparency mask for pointer signals. If mask test fails on a StyleBox assigned as mask to a control, clicks and motion signals will go through it to the one below.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StyleBox.test_mask(GodotEngine.Vector2,GodotEngine.Rect2)
member.summary: Test a position in a rectangle, return whether it passes the mask test.

member.summary: Set the default offset "offset" of the margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum) for a StyleBox, Controls that draw styleboxes with context inside need to know the margin, so the border of the stylebox is not occluded.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StyleBox.get_default_margin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the default offset of the margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum) of a StyleBox, Controls that draw styleboxes with context inside need to know the margin, so the border of the stylebox is not occluded.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StyleBox.get_margin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the offset of margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StyleBox.get_minimum_size
member.summary: Return the minimum size that this stylebox can be shrunk to.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.StyleBox.get_offset
member.summary: Return the "offset" of a stylebox, this is a helper function, like writing [code]Vector2(style.get_margin(MARGIN_LEFT), style.get_margin(MARGIN_TOP))[/code].

member.name: T:GodotEngine.StyleBoxEmpty
member.summary: Empty stylebox (really does not display anything).

member.summary: Stylebox of a single color. Displays the stylebox of a single color, alternatively a border with light/dark colors can be assigned.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.StyleBoxTexture
member.summary: Texture Based 3x3 scale style. This stylebox performs a 3x3 scaling of a texture, where only the center cell is fully stretched. This allows for the easy creation of bordered styles.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.SurfaceTool
member.summary: The [SurfaceTool] is used to construct a [Mesh] by specifying vertex attributes individually. It can be used to construct a [Mesh] from script. All properties except index need to be added before a call to [method add_vertex]. For example adding vertex colors and UVs looks like [codeblock] var st = SurfaceTool.new() st.begin(Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES) st.add_color(Color(1, 0, 0)) st.add_uv(Vector2(0, 0)) st.add_vertex(Vector3(0, 0, 0)) [/codeblock] The [SurfaceTool] now contains one vertex of a triangle which has a UV coordinate and a specified [Color]. If another vertex were added without calls to [method add_uv] or [method add_color] then the last values would be used. It is very important that vertex attributes are passed [b]before[/b] the call to [method add_vertex], failure to do this will result in an error when committing the vertex information to a mesh.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SurfaceTool.begin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called before adding any Vertices. Takes the primitive type as an argument (e.g. Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SurfaceTool.add_vertex(GodotEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Specify position of current Vertex. Should be called after specifying other vertex properties (e.g. Color, UV).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SurfaceTool.add_color(GodotEngine.Color)
member.summary: Specify a [Color] for the next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify a normal for the next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify a Tangent for the next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify UV Coordinate for next Vertex to use.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SurfaceTool.add_uv2(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Specify an optional second set of UV coordinates for next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Add an array of bones for the next Vertex to use.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SurfaceTool.add_weights(System.Single[])
member.summary: Specify weight value for next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify whether current Vertex (if using only Vertex arrays) or current index (if also using index arrays) should utilize smooth normals for normal calculation.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.SurfaceTool.add_triangle_fan(GodotEngine.Vector3[],GodotEngine.Vector2[],GodotEngine.Color[],GodotEngine.Vector2[],GodotEngine.Vector3[],System.Object[])

member.summary: Adds an index to index array if you are using indexed Vertices. Does not need to be called before adding Vertex.

member.summary: Shrinks Vertex array by creating an index array. Avoids reusing Vertices.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.TCP_Server
member.summary: TCP Server class. Listens to connections on a port and returns a [StreamPeerTCP] when got a connection.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.TCP_Server.listen(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Listen on the "port" binding to "bind_address". If "bind_address" is set as "*" (default), the server will listen on all available addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6). If "bind_address" is set as "0.0.0.0" (for IPv4) or "::" (for IPv6), the server will listen on all available addresses matching that IP type. If "bind_address" is set to any valid address (e.g. "192.168.1.101", "::1", etc), the server will only listen on the interface with that addresses (or fail if no interface with the given address exists).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.TCP_Server.is_connection_available
member.summary: Return true if a connection is available for taking.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.TCP_Server.take_connection
member.summary: If a connection is available, return a StreamPeerTCP with the connection/

member.name: M:GodotEngine.TCP_Server.stop
member.summary: Stop listening.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.TextureButton
member.summary: Button that can be themed with textures. This is like a regular [Button] but can be themed by assigning textures to it. This button is intended to be easy to theme, however a regular button can expand (that uses styleboxes) and still be better if the interface is expect to have internationalization of texts. Only the normal texture is required, the others are optional.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.TextureProgress
member.summary: [ProgressBar] implementation that is easier to theme (by just passing a few textures).

member.name: T:GodotEngine.TextureRect
member.summary: Control frame that simply draws an assigned texture. It can stretch or not. It's a simple way to just show an image in a UI.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Theme
member.summary: Theme for skinning controls. Controls can be skinned individually, but for complex applications it's more efficient to just create a global theme that defines everything. This theme can be applied to any [Control], and it and its children will automatically use it. Theme resources can be alternatively loaded by writing them in a .theme file, see docs for more info.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.TileMap
member.summary: Node for 2D tile-based games. Tilemaps use a [TileSet] which contain a list of tiles (textures, their rect and a collision) and are used to create complex grid-based maps. To optimize drawing and culling (sort of like [GridMap]), you can specify a quadrant size, so chunks of the map will be batched together at drawing time.

member.summary: Set the Y sort mode. Enabled Y sort mode means that children of the tilemap will be drawn in the order defined by their Y coordinate. A tile with a higher Y coordinate will therefore be drawn later, potentially covering up the tile(s) above it if its sprite is higher than its cell size.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Tween
member.summary: Node useful for animations with unknown start and end points, procedural animations, making one node follow another, and other simple behavior. Because it is easy to get it wrong, here is a quick usage example: [codeblock] var tween = get_node("Tween") tween.interpolate_property(get_node("Node2D_to_move"), "transform/pos", Vector2(0,0), Vector2(100,100), 1, Tween.TRANS_LINEAR, Tween.EASE_IN_OUT) tween.start() [/codeblock] Some of the methods of this class require a property name. You can get the property name by hovering over the property in the inspector of the editor. Many of the methods accept [code]trans_type[/code] and [code]ease_type[/code]. The first accepts an TRANS_* constant, and refers to the way the timing of the animation is handled (you might want to see [code]http://easings.net/[/code] for some examples). The second accepts an EASE_* constant, and controls the where [code]trans_type[/code] is applied to the interpolation (in the beginning, the end, or both). If you don't know which transision and easing to pick, you can try different TRANS_* constants with EASE_IN_OUT, and use the one that looks best.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TWEEN_PROCESS_FIXED
member.summary: The [Tween] should use [code]_fixed_process[/code] for timekeeping when this is enabled.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TWEEN_PROCESS_IDLE
member.summary: The [Tween] should use [code]_process[/code] for timekeeping when this is enabled (default).

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_LINEAR
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated linearly.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_SINE
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated using a sine wave.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_QUINT
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated with a quinary (to the power of 5) function.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_QUART
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated with a quartic (to the power of 4) function.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_QUAD
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated with a quadratic (to the power of 2) function.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_EXPO
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated with a exponential (some number to the power of x) function.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_ELASTIC
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated with elasticity, wiggling around the edges.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_CUBIC
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated with a cubic (to the power of 3) function.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_CIRC
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated with a function using square roots.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_BOUNCE
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated by bouncing at, but never surpassing, the end.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.TRANS_BACK
member.summary: Means that the animation is interpolated backing out at edges.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.EASE_IN
member.summary: Signifies that the interpolation should be focused in the beginning.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.EASE_OUT
member.summary: Signifies that the interpolation should be focused in the end.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.EASE_IN_OUT
member.summary: Signifies that the interpolation should be focused in both ends.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.Tween.EASE_OUT_IN
member.summary: Signifies that the interpolation should be focused in both ends, but they should be switched (a bit hard to explain, try it for yourself to be sure).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.is_active
member.summary: Returns true if any tweens are currently running, and false otherwise. Note that this method doesn't consider tweens that have ended.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.set_active(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activate/deactivate the tween. You can use this for pausing animations, though [method stop_all] and [method resume_all] might be more fit for this.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.is_repeat
member.summary: Returns true if repeat has been set from editor GUI or [method set_repeat].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.set_repeat(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make the tween repeat after all tweens have finished.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.set_speed_scale(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the speed multiplier of the tween. Set it to 1 for normal speed, 2 for two times nromal speed, and 0.5 for half of the normal speed. Setting it to 0 would pause the animation, but you might consider using [method set_active] or [method stop_all] and [method resume_all] for this.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.get_speed_scale
member.summary: Returns the speed that has been set from editor GUI or [method set_repeat].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.set_tween_process_mode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set whether the Tween uses [code]_process[/code] or [code]_fixed_process[/code] (accepts TWEEN_PROCESS_IDLE and TWEEN_PROCESS_FIXED constants, respectively).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.get_tween_process_mode
member.summary: Returns the process mode that has been set from editor GUI or [method set_tween_process_mode]

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.start
member.summary: Start the tween node. You can define tweens both before and after this.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.reset(GodotEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Resets a tween to the initial value (the one given, not the one before the tween), given its object and property/method pair. Passing empty String as key will reset all tweens for given object.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.reset_all
member.summary: Resets all tweens to their initial values (the ones given, not those before the tween).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.stop(GodotEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Stop animating a tween, given its object and property/method pair. Passing empty String as key will stop all tweens for given object.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.stop_all
member.summary: Stop animating all tweens.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.resume(GodotEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Continue animating a stopped tween, given its object and property/method pair. Passing empty String as key will resume all tweens for given object.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.resume_all
member.summary: Continue animating all stopped tweens.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.remove(GodotEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Stop animating and completely remove a tween, given its object and property/method pair. Passing empty String as key will remove all tweens for given object.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.remove_all
member.summary: Stop animating and completely remove all tweens.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.seek(System.Single)
member.summary: Seek the animation to the given [code]time[/code] in seconds.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.tell
member.summary: Returns the current time of the tween.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.get_runtime
member.summary: Returns the time needed for all tweens to end in seconds, measured from the start. Thus, if you have two tweens, one ending 10 seconds after the start and the other - 20 seconds, it would return 20 seconds, as by that time all tweens would have finished.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.interpolate_property(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Animate [code]property[/code] of [code]object[/code] from [code]initial_val[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.interpolate_method(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Animate [code]method[/code] of [code]object[/code] from [code]initial_val[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. Methods are animated by calling them with consecuitive values. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.interpolate_callback(GodotEngine.Object,System.Single,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Call [code]callback[/code] of [code]object[/code] after [code]duration[/code]. [code]arg1[/code]-[code]arg5[/code] are arguments to be passed to the callback.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.interpolate_deferred_callback(GodotEngine.Object,System.Single,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Call [code]callback[/code] of [code]object[/code] after [code]duration[/code] on the main thread (similar to [methog Object.call_deferred). [code]arg1[/code]-[code]arg5[/code] are arguments to be passed to the callback.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.follow_property(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object,GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Follow [code]property[/code] of [code]object[/code] and apply it on [code]target_property[/code] of [code]target[/code], beginning from [code]initial_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. Note that [code]target:target_property[/code] would equal [code]object:property[/code] at the end of the tween. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.follow_method(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object,GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Follow [code]method[/code] of [code]object[/code] and apply the returned value on [code]target_method[/code] of [code]target[/code], beginning from [code]initial_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] later. Methods are animated by calling them with consequitive values. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.targeting_property(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Animate [code]property[/code] of [code]object[/code] from the current value of the [code]initial_val[/code] property of [code]initial[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Tween.targeting_method(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Animate [code]method[/code] of [code]object[/code] from the value returned by [code]initial.initial_method[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. Methods are animated by calling them with consecuitive values. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.UndoRedo
member.summary: Helper to manage UndoRedo in the editor or custom tools. It works by storing calls to functions in both 'do' an 'undo' lists. Common behavior is to create an action, then add do/undo calls to functions or property changes, then committing the action.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.create_action(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new action. After this is called, do all your calls to [method add_do_method], [method add_undo_method], [method add_do_property] and [method add_undo_property].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.commit_action
member.summary: Commit the action. All 'do' methods/properties are called/set when this function is called.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.add_do_property(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set a property with a custom value.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.add_undo_property(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Undo setting of a property with a custom value.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.add_do_reference(GodotEngine.Object)
member.summary: Add a 'do' reference that will be erased if the 'do' history is lost. This is useful mostly for new nodes created for the 'do' call. Do not use for resources.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.add_undo_reference(GodotEngine.Object)
member.summary: Add an 'undo' reference that will be erased if the 'undo' history is lost. This is useful mostly for nodes removed with the 'do' call (not the 'undo' call!).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.clear_history
member.summary: Clear the undo/redo history and associated references.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.get_current_action_name
member.summary: Get the name of the current action.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.UndoRedo.get_version
member.summary: Get the version, each time a new action is committed, the version number of the UndoRedo is increased automatically. This is useful mostly to check if something changed from a saved version.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Viewport
member.summary: A Viewport creates a different view into the screen, or a sub-view inside another viewport. Children 2D Nodes will display on it, and children Camera 3D nodes will render on it too. Optionally, a viewport can have its own 2D or 3D world, so they don't share what they draw with other viewports. If a viewport is a child of a [Control], it will automatically take up its same rect and position, otherwise they must be set manually. Viewports can also choose to be audio listeners, so they generate positional audio depending on a 2D or 3D camera child of it. Also, viewports can be assigned to different screens in case the devices have multiple screens. Finally, viewports can also behave as render targets, in which case they will not be visible unless the associated texture is used to draw.

member.summary: Update the render target only when it is visible. This is the default value.

member.summary: Set the size override of the viewport. If the enable parameter is true, it would use the override, otherwise it would use the default size. member.name: T:GodotEngine.VisualServer
member.summary: Server for anything visible. The visual server is the API backend for everything visible. The whole scene system mounts on it to display. The visual server is completely opaque, the internals are entirely implementation specific and cannot be accessed.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.WeakRef
member.summary: A weakref can hold a [Reference], without contributing to the reference counter. A weakref can be created from an [Object] using [method @GDScript.weakref]. If this object is not a reference, weakref still works, however, it does not have any effect on the object. Weakrefs are useful in cases where multiple classes have variables that refer to eachother. Without weakrefs, using these classes could lead to memory leaks, since both references keep eachother from being released. Making part of the variables a weakref can prevent this cyclic dependency, and allows the references to be released.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.WeakRef.get_ref
member.summary: Returns the [Object] this weakref is referring to.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.WorldEnvironment
member.summary: The [WorldEnvironment] node can be added to a scene in order to set default [Environment] variables for the scene. The [WorldEnvironment] can be overridden by an [Environment] node set on the current [Camera]. Additionally, only one [WorldEnvironment] may be instanced in a given scene at a time. The [WorldEnvironment] allows the user to specify default lighting parameters (e.g. ambient lighting), various post-processing effects (e.g. SSAO, DOF, Tonemapping), and how to draw the background (e.g. solid color, skybox).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.WorldEnvironment.set_environment(GodotEngine.Environment)
member.summary: Set the currently bound [Environment] to the one specified.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.WorldEnvironment.get_environment
member.summary: Return the [Environment] currently bound.
