member.name: T:GodotEngine.YSort
member.summary: Sort all child nodes based on their Y positions. The child node must inherit from [CanvasItem] for it to be sorted. Nodes that have a higher Y position will be drawn later, so they will appear on top of nodes that have a lower Y position.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.YSort.set_sort_enabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether the children nodes are sorted or not. (default true)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.YSort.is_sort_enabled
member.summary: Returns true if the children nodes are being sorted.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Directory
M:GodotEngine.Directory.open(System.String)
member.summary: Open an existing directory of the filesystem. The [i]path[/i] argument can be within the project tree ([code]res://folder[/code]), the user directory ([code]user://folder[/code]) or an absolute path of the user filesystem (e.g. [code]/tmp/folder[/code] or [code]C:\tmp\folder[/code]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or ERR_*).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.list_dir_begin(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialise the stream used to list all files and directories using the [method get_next] function, closing the current opened stream if needed. Once the stream has been processed, it should typically be closed with [method list_dir_end]. If you pass [code]skip_navigational[/code], then [code].[/code] and [code]..[/code] would be filtered out. If you pass [code]skip_hidden[/code], then hidden files would be filtered out.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.get_next
member.summary: Return the next element (file or directory) in the current directory (including [code].[/code] and [code]..[/code], unless [code]skip_navigational[/code] was given to [method list_dir_begin]). The name of the file or directory is returned (and not its full path). Once the stream has been fully processed, the method returns an empty String and closes the stream automatically (i.e. [method list_dir_end] would not be mandatory in such a case).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.current_is_dir
member.summary: Return whether the current item processed with the last [method get_next] call is a directory ([code].[/code] and [code]..[/code] are considered directories).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.list_dir_end
member.summary: Close the current stream opened with [method list_dir_begin] (whether it has been fully processed with [method get_next] or not does not matter).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.get_drive_count
member.summary: On Windows, return the number of drives (partitions) mounted on the current filesystem. On other platforms, the method returns 0.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.get_drive(System.Int32)
member.summary: On Windows, return the name of the drive (partition) passed as an argument (e.g. [code]C:[/code]). On other platforms, or if the requested drive does not existed, the method returns an empty String.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.change_dir(System.String)
member.summary: Change the currently opened directory to the one passed as an argument. The argument can be relative to the current directory (e.g. [code]newdir[/code] or [code]../newdir[/code]), or an absolute path (e.g. [code]/tmp/newdir[/code] or [code]res://somedir/newdir[/code]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or ERR_*).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.get_current_dir
member.summary: Return the absolute path to the currently opened directory (e.g. [code]res://folder[/code] or [code]C:\tmp\folder[/code]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.make_dir(System.String)
member.summary: Create a directory. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. The target directory should be placed in an already existing directory (to create the full path recursively, see [method make_dir_recursive]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.make_dir_recursive(System.String)
member.summary: Create a target directory and all necessary intermediate directories in its path, by calling [method make_dir] recursively. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.file_exists(System.String)
member.summary: Return whether the target file exists. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.dir_exists(System.String)
member.summary: Return whether the target directory exists. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.get_space_left
member.summary: On Unix desktop systems, return the available space on the current directory's disk. On other platforms, this information is not available and the method returns 0 or -1.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.copy(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copy the [i]from[/i] file to the [i]to[/i] destination. Both arguments should be paths to files, either relative or absolute. If the destination file exists and is not access-protected, it will be overwritten. Returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.rename(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rename (move) the [i]from[/i] file to the [i]to[/i] destination. Both arguments should be paths to files, either relative or absolute. If the destination file exists and is not access-protected, it will be overwritten. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or FAILED).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Directory.remove(System.String)
member.summary: Delete the target file or an empty directory. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. If the target directory is not empty, the operation will fail. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or FAILED).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Engine.set_iterations_per_second(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the amount of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Engine.get_iterations_per_second
member.summary: Return the amount of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Engine.get_custom_level
member.summary: Returns the value of the commandline argument "-level".

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Engine.get_frames_drawn
member.summary: Return the total amount of frames drawn.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Engine.get_frames_per_second
member.summary: Returns the frames per second of the running game.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Engine.get_main_loop
member.summary: Return the main loop object (see [MainLoop] and [SceneTree]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Engine.get_version_info
member.summary: Returns the current engine version information in a Dictionary. "major" - Holds the major version number as a String "minor" - Holds the minor version number as a String "patch" - Holds the patch version number as a String "status" - Holds the status (e.g. "beta", "rc1", "rc2", ... "stable") as a String "revision" - Holds the revision (e.g. "custom-build") as a String "string" - major + minor + patch + status + revision in a single String

member.name: T:GodotEngine.File
F:GodotEngine.File.READ
member.summary: Open the file for reading.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.File.WRITE
member.summary: Open the file for writing. Create it if the file not exists and truncate if it exists.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.File.READ_WRITE
member.summary: Open the file for reading and writing, without truncating the file.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.File.WRITE_READ
member.summary: Open the file for reading and writing. Create it if the file not exists and truncate if it exists.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.File.COMPRESSION_FASTLZ
member.summary: Use the FastLZ compression method.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.File.COMPRESSION_DEFLATE
member.summary: Use the Deflate compression method.

member.name: F:GodotEngine.File.COMPRESSION_ZSTD
member.summary: Use the Zstd compression method.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.open_encrypted(System.String,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Open an encrypted file in write or read mode. You need to pass a binary key to encrypt/decrypt it.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.open_encrypted_with_pass(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Open an encrypted file in write or read mode. You need to pass a password to encrypt/decrypt it.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.open_compressed(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Open a compressed file for reading or writing. The compression_mode can be set as one of the COMPRESSION_* constants.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.open(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Open the file for writing or reading, depending on the flags.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.close
member.summary: Close the currently opened file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.is_open
member.summary: Return whether the file is currently opened.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.seek(System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the file reading/writing cursor to the specified position (in bytes from the beginning of the file).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.seek_end(System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the file reading/writing cursor to the specified position (in bytes from the end of the file). Note that this is an offset, so you should use negative numbers or the cursor will be at the end of the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_pos
member.summary: Return the file cursor position.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_len
member.summary: Return the size of the file in bytes.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.eof_reached
member.summary: Return whether the file cursor reached the end of the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_8
member.summary: Get the next 8 bits from the file as an integer.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_16
member.summary: Get the next 16 bits from the file as an integer.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_32
member.summary: Get the next 32 bits from the file as an integer.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_64
member.summary: Get the next 64 bits from the file as an integer.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_float
member.summary: Get the next 32 bits from the file as a floating point number.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_double
member.summary: Get the next 64 bits from the file as a floating point number.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_real
member.summary: Get the next bits from the file as a floating point number.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_buffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get next len bytes of the file as a [PoolByteArray].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_line
member.summary: Get the next line of the file as a [String].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_as_text
member.summary: Get the whole file as a [String].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_md5(System.String)
member.summary: Return a md5 String representing the file at the given path or an empty [String] on failure.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_sha256(System.String)
member.summary: Return a sha256 String representing the file at the given path or an empty [String] on failure.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_endian_swap
member.summary: Get whether endian swap is enabled for this file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.set_endian_swap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether to swap the endianness of the file. Enable this if you're dealing with files written in big endian machines. Note that this is about the file format, not CPU type. This is always reseted to [code]false[/code] whenever you open the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_error
member.summary: Get the last error that happened when trying to perform operations. Compare with the [code]ERR_FILE_*[/code] constants from [@Global Scope].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_var
member.summary: Get the next Variant value from the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_csv_line(System.String)
member.summary: Get the next value of the file in CSV (Comma Separated Values) format. You can pass a different delimiter to use other than the default "," (comma).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_8(System.Int32)
member.summary: Store an integer as 8 bits in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_16(System.Int32)
member.summary: Store an integer as 16 bits in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Store an integer as 32 bits in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_64(System.Int32)
member.summary: Store an integer as 64 bits in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_float(System.Single)
member.summary: Store a floating point number as 32 bits in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_double(System.Single)
member.summary: Store a floating point number as 64 bits in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_real(System.Single)
member.summary: Store a floating point number in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_buffer(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Store the given array of bytes in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_line(System.String)
member.summary: Store the given [String] as a line in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_string(System.String)
member.summary: Store the given [String] in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_var(System.Object)
member.summary: Store any Variant value in the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.store_pascal_string(System.String)
member.summary: Store the given [String] as a line in the file in Pascal format (i.e. also store the length of the string).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.get_pascal_string
member.summary: Get a [String] saved in Pascal format from the file.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.File.file_exists(System.String)
member.summary: Get whether or not the file in the specified path exists.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Mutex
member.summary: A synchronization Mutex. Element used in multi-threadding. Basically a binary [Semaphore]. Guarantees that only one thread has this lock, can be used to protect a critical section.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Mutex.lock
member.summary: Lock this [Mutex], blocks until it is unlocked by the current owner.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Mutex.try_lock
member.summary: Try locking this [Mutex], does not block. Returns [OK] on success else [ERR_BUSY].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Mutex.unlock
member.summary: Unlock this [Mutex], leaving it to others threads.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.OS
member.summary: Operating System functions. OS Wraps the most common functionality to communicate with the host Operating System, such as: mouse grabbing, mouse cursors, clipboard, video mode, date and time, timers, environment variables, execution of binaries, command line, etc.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_clipboard(System.String)
member.summary: Set clipboard to the OS.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_clipboard
member.summary: Get clipboard from the host OS.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_screen_count
member.summary: Returns the number of displays attached to the host machine

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_current_screen
member.summary: Returns the current screen index (0 padded).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_screen_size(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the dimensions in pixels of the specified screen.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_screen_dpi(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the dots per inch density of the specified screen. On Android Devices, the actual screen densities are grouped into six generalized densities: ldpi - 120 dpi mdpi - 160 dpi hdpi - 240 dpi xhdpi - 320 dpi xxhdpi - 480 dpi xxxhdpi - 640 dpi

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_window_position
member.summary: Returns the window position relative to the screen, the origin is the top left corner, +Y axis goes to the bottom and +X axis goes to the right.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_window_position(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the window to the specified position (this function could be restricted by the window manager, meaning that there could be some unreachable areas of the screen).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_window_size
member.summary: Returns the size of the window (without counting window manager decorations).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_window_size(GodotEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the window size to the specified size.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_window_fullscreen(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets window fullscreen mode to the [i]enabled[/i] argument, [i]enabled[/i] is a toggle for the fullscreen mode, calling the function with [i]enabled[/i] true when the screen is not on fullscreen mode will cause the screen to go to fullscreen mode, calling the function with [i]enabled[/i] false when the screen is in fullscreen mode will cause the window to exit the fullscreen mode.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.is_window_fullscreen
member.summary: Returns whether the window is in fullscreen mode or not.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_window_resizable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the window resizable state, if the window is not resizable it will preserve the dimensions specified in the project settings.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.is_window_resizable
member.summary: Returns whether the window is resizable or not.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_window_minimized(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether the window is minimized.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.is_window_minimized
member.summary: Return true if the window is minimized.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_window_maximized(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the window size to maximized.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.is_window_maximized
member.summary: Return true if the window is maximized.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.request_attention
member.summary: Request the user attention to the window. It'll flash the taskbar button on Windows or bounce the dock icon on OSX.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_borderless_window
member.summary: Returns true if the current window is borderless.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_screen_orientation(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the current screen orientation, the argument value must be one of the SCREEN_ORIENTATION constants in this class.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_screen_orientation
member.summary: Returns the current screen orientation, the return value will be one of the SCREEN_ORIENTATION constants in this class.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_keep_screen_on(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set keep screen on if true, or goes to sleep by device setting if false. (for Android/iOS)

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.is_keep_screen_on
member.summary: Returns whether the screen is being kept on or not.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_window_title(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the window title to the specified string.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.set_low_processor_usage_mode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set to true to enable the low cpu usage mode. In this mode, the screen only redraws when there are changes, and a considerable sleep time is inserted between frames. This way, editors using the engine UI only use very little cpu.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.is_in_low_processor_usage_mode
member.summary: Return true if low cpu usage mode is enabled.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_processor_count
member.summary: Returns the number of cores available in the host machine.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_executable_path
member.summary: Return the path to the current engine executable.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.execute(System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute the binary file in given path, optionally blocking until it returns. A process ID is returned. If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.kill(System.Int32)
member.summary: Kill a process ID (this method can be used to kill processes that were not spawned by the game).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_process_id
member.summary: Returns the game process ID

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_environment(System.String)
member.summary: Return an environment variable.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.has_environment(System.String)
member.summary: Return true if an environment variable exists.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_name
member.summary: Return the name of the host OS. Possible values are: "Android", "Haiku", "iOS", "HTML5", "OSX", "Server", "Windows", "UWP", "X11".

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_cmdline_args
member.summary: Return the commandline passed to the engine.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_datetime(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns current datetime as a dictionary of keys: year, month, day, weekday, dst (daylight savings time), hour, minute, second.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_date(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns current date as a dictionary of keys: year, month, day, weekday, dst (daylight savings time).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_time(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns current time as a dictionary of keys: hour, minute, second

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_unix_time
member.summary: Return the current unix timestamp.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_datetime_from_unix_time(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a dictionary of time values when given epoch time. Dictionary Time values will be a union of values from [method get_time] and [method get_date] dictionaries (with the exception of dst = day light standard time, as it cannot be determined from epoch).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_unix_time_from_datetime(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Get an epoch time value from a dictionary of time values. [code]datetime[/code] must be populated with the following keys: year, month, day, hour, minute, second. You can pass the output from [method get_datetime_from_unix_time] directly into this function. Daylight savings time (dst), if present, is ignored.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.delay_usec(System.Int32)
member.summary: Delay executing of the current thread by given microseconds.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.delay_msec(System.Int32)
member.summary: Delay executing of the current thread by given milliseconds.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_ticks_msec
member.summary: Return the amount of time passed in milliseconds since the engine started.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_locale
member.summary: Return the host OS locale.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_latin_keyboard_variant
member.summary: Returns the current latin keyboard variant as a String. Possible return values are: "QWERTY", "AZERTY", "QZERTY", "DVORAK", "NEO" or "ERROR"

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_model_name
member.summary: Returns the model name of the current device.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.can_draw
member.summary: Return true if the host OS allows drawing.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.is_stdout_verbose
member.summary: Return true if the engine was executed with -v (verbose stdout).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.can_use_threads
member.summary: Returns if the current host platform is using multiple threads.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.dump_memory_to_file(System.String)
member.summary: Dumps the memory allocation ringlist to a file (only works in debug). Entry format per line: "Address - Size - Description"

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.dump_resources_to_file(System.String)
member.summary: Dumps all used resources to file (only works in debug). Entry format per line: "Resource Type : Resource Location" At the end of the file is a statistic of all used Resource Types.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.has_virtual_keyboard
member.summary: Returns true if the platform has a virtual keyboard, false otherwise.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.show_virtual_keyboard(System.String)
member.summary: Shows the virtual keyboard if the platform has one. The [i]existing_text[/i] parameter is useful for implementing your own LineEdit, as it tells the virtual keyboard what text has already been typed (the virtual keyboard uses it for auto-correct and predictions).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.hide_virtual_keyboard
member.summary: Hides the virtual keyboard if it is shown, does nothing otherwise.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_static_memory_peak_usage
member.summary: Return the max amount of static memory used (only works in debug).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_dynamic_memory_usage
member.summary: Return the total amount of dynamic memory used (only works in debug).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_data_dir
member.summary: Return the absolute directory path of user data path([user://]).

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.get_scancode_string(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the given scancode as a string (e.g. Return values: "Escape", "Shift+Escape").

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.find_scancode_from_string(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the scancode of the given string (e.g. "Escape")

member.name: M:GodotEngine.OS.alert(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a modal dialog box utilizing the host OS.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ResourceLoader
member.summary: Resource Loader. This is a static object accessible as [ResourceLoader]. GDScript has a simplified load() function, though.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourceLoader.load_interactive(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Load a resource interactively, the returned object allows to load with high granularity.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourceLoader.get_recognized_extensions_for_type(System.String)
member.summary: Return the list of recognized extensions for a resource type.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourceLoader.set_abort_on_missing_resources(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the behavior on missing sub-resources. Default is to abort load.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.ResourceSaver
member.summary: Resource Saving Interface. This interface is used for saving resources to disk.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.ResourceSaver.save(System.String,GodotEngine.Resource,System.Int32)
member.summary: Save a resource to disk, to a given path.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Semaphore
member.summary: A synchronization Semaphore. Element used in multi-threadding. Initialized to zero on creation.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Semaphore.wait
member.summary: Tries to wait for the [Semaphore], if its value is zero, blocks until non-zero.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Semaphore.post
member.summary: Lowers the [Semaphore], allowing one more thread in.

member.name: T:GodotEngine.Thread
member.summary: A unit of execution in a process. Can run methods on [Object]\ s simultaneously. The use of synchronization via [Mutex], [Semaphore] is advised if working with shared objects.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Thread.start(GodotEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Start a new [Thread], it will run "method" on object "instance" using "userdata" as an argument and running with "priority", one of PRIORITY_* enum. Returns OK on success, or ERR_CANT_CREATE on failure.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Thread.get_id
member.summary: Return the id of the thread, uniquely identifying it among all threads.

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Thread.is_active
member.summary: Whether this thread is currently active, an active Thread cannot start work on a new method but can be joined with [method wait_to_finish].

member.name: M:GodotEngine.Thread.wait_to_finish
member.summary: Joins the [Thread] and waits for it to finish. Returns what the method called returned.
